Doña  Santos es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante con su familia, no tiene hijos que depende de ella. Es la líder del grupo porque sus demás compañeras confían en ella por ser la persona que siempre esta pendiente de sus pagos y de sus renovaciones. 
Doña  Santos está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de leche, sal, papas, pataste, plátanos, cebollas, chiles, remolachas, lechuga, repollo, etc. para seguir elaborando cuajada y golosinas está muy contenta por el apoyo que Prisma le ha dado a su negocio.
Doña  Santos su sueño es seguir creciendo en su negocio y también desea mejorar su casa al igual que sus compañeras de grupo que también son personas que luchan por salir adelante vendiendo sus productos.
Doña Virginia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas.
Doña María se dedica a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Señora Santos is 48-years old, is married and lives with her husband.  Their home is located in a community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.  She has made her living for the last ten years selling fresh cheese and sweets to the friends and neighbors who stop by each day. 
Doña  Santos is an enterprising woman who wants for herself and her family to get ahead.  She does not have dependent children.  She is the leader of the communal bank because the other members trust her to be the one in charge of their payments and their renewals.  
Doña  Santos is requesting the loan in order to purchase milk, salt, potatoes, "pataste" (a local vegetable), bananas, onions, chiles, beets, lettuce, cabbage etc. to keep making fresh cheese and sweets.  She is very happy for the support that Prisma has given to her business. 
Doña Santos hopes to continue growing her business and also to improve her house.  Just like the other members of the communal bank, they are all working to get ahead by selling their products. 
Doña Virginia makes her living making and selling tortillas.
Doña María makes her living selling clothing.

loans.use: to purchase milk, salt, potatoes, "pataste" (a local vegetable), bananas, onions, chiles, beets, lettuce, cabbage etc. for her business.

loans.name: G.s Manos Hacendosas Group

texts.es:
La Señora Juana, tiene 60 años de edad tiene no tiene hijos dependientes,  está soltera, Su actividad es el comercio, elabora uniformes escolares para varones, niñas, alumnos juveniles y adultos, cuenta con más de 23 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad generadora de ingresos.
Doña Juana tiene muy buena clientela por su experiencia en confeccionar uniformes esto le permite que sus clientes estén muy satisfechos con los servicios que les brinda, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de Telas, hilos, agujas, alfileres, etc.  Y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, y con los ingresos que obtenga espera cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Doña Juana su sueños es tener una mejor calidad de vida y una vejez llena de tranquilidad y al  igual que sus compañeras de grupo son personas muy trabajadoras. 
Doña María se dedica a la venta de tortillas.
Doña Zuelen cuenta con una venta de Calzado y ropa interior desde hace varios años.


Danli, Honduras - Enero del 2013
texts.en:
Señora Juana is 60- years old and does not have any dependent children.  She is single.  Her business is making school uniforms for men, girls and young and adult students.  She has been making her living in this business, which is her source of income, for more than twenty-three years. 
Doña Juana has a very good clientele.  Her experience making uniforms leaves her customers very satisfied with the service they receive.  She is requesting the loan to purchase fabric, thread, needles, pins, etc. so she can satisfy her customers' requests.  With the incomes she earns, Doña Juana hopes to cover her family's expenses and financial obligations. 
Doña Juana dreams of having a better quality of life and tranquility in her old age.  She and the other members of her communal bank are very hard-working people.
Doña María makes her living selling tortillas.
Doña Zuelen has been selling shoes and undergarments for a few years. 


Danli, Honduras - January, 2013

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, needles, pins, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, seafood, and other ingredients to prepare the food.

loans.name: Che

texts.en:
She is married and has six children, two of them below the age of fifteen. They both live in a four-room apartment house in Bamenda, in the northwest region of Cameroon.
I
She has encountered some challenges in life: her mother's sickness; an accident that almost took away her life; the death of her brother, an incident that she hates thinking of; and she was attacked by armed robbers. In addition to all of these problems, she also faces the problem of inadequate capital to start up a business. 

Given a loan, she plans to buy fuel wood, pay labor for splitting, and invest part in dressmaking. She knows this activity will succeed because she has been doing this business for a very long period, and her community will provide a ready market for her products and more still. She has a large market due to the increasing population and increasing demand for her products. This activity will help the community in that they will have quality dresses
 at affordable prices.

She plans to use the profits generated from this activity to pay the fees for her children in school and also to cater for their basic needs, such as hospital bills.

loans.use: to pay for fuel wood and cloths

loans.name: Nkwain

texts.en:
She is married and blessed with four children, all of them above the age of fifteen. They all live in a four-room apartment house in Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon.

She has faced some challenges in life, such as sickness and a fire that almost resulted in her death. Also, she once lost her money. In addition to all of these problems, she also faces the problem of having no capital to start up a business. 

With this loan, she plans to buy fuel wood, potatoes, and bananas for her chips, and tins of oil for the frying of the chips. She believes this activity will succeed because she has been doing this business for a very long period, and the community will provide a ready market for her products and more still. She has a large market due to the ever increasing population and demand for her products. This activity will help the community in that they will have quality wood and chips at good moderate prices.     

She plans to use the profits generated from this activity to pay the fees for her children in school and also to cater for their basic needs, such as hospital bills.

loans.use: to pay for fuelwood, plantains, and oil

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en:
She is married and has ten children of which five are below the ages of fifteen. They live in a four room apartment house in the Bamenda North West region of Cameroon.

She has encountered some challenges in life, such as when her mother fell sick and she had no money to take care of her drugs. She also had an accident that almost took away her life. Amongst all of these problems, she faced the problem of inadequate capital to start up a business. 

Given a loan, she plans to buy fuel wood, pay labor for wood splitting, buy koki beans and buy piglets. She knows this activity will succeed because she has been doing this business for a very long period, and her community will provide a ready market for the products. Additionally, she has a large market due to the increasing population and th increasing demand for her products. This activity will help the community in that they will have quality pigs at affordable prices.   

She plans to use the profits generated from this activity to pay the school fees for her children and also to care for their basic needs, such as hospital bills.

loans.use: to pay for fuel wood, koki beans and piglets

loans.name: Jenny Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señorita. Jenny es una socia muy joven que se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, en este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho más a sus amigas y vecinas con quienes cada vez van estrechando los lasos de amistad. Vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de una estructura arquitectónica que se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señorita. Jenny tiene 25 años, es soltera y vive con su mamá  quien se dedica al comercio, la casa en la que viven es arrendada. 

Ella desde hace 7 años se dedica a la costura, actividad que la aprendió trabajando y ahora labora en una fábrica de lunes a sábados. Hace un año también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. 

Su crédito va ha a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y una máquina de coser para ir poco a poco iniciando con su propio negocio. 

Su meta es tener su propio taller de costura.
texts.en:
Jenny is a young member who is now on her fourth loan with the "Mujeres Floreciendo" communal bank.  Since her first loan she has come to know her friends and neighbours much better and more and more her friendships with them are growing stronger.  Jenny lives in the Totoracocha district in the city of Cuenca.  The city enjoys a mixture of colonial and modern architecture and its people are kind, friendly and still hold on to the culture and traditions of their towns.

Jenny is 25 years old.  She is single and lives with her mother, a trader.  The house where they live is rented.

For seven years Jenny has been working as a seamstress, a skill which she learned through work.  She now works in a factory from Monday through Saturday.  She has now been selling cosmetics for a year.

Her loan will be invested in buying cosmetics and a sewing machine so that, little by little, she can start her own business.

Her goal is to have her own sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rosa Leticia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa forma parte del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo desde hace 4 años, en todo este tiempo ha consolidado una gran amistad y compañerismo con todos los integrantes del banco comunal. Vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que tiene una arquitectura que se mezcla entre casas de adobe y las modernas, esta parroquia ha tenido un gran crecimiento e impulso gracias al comercio, también se dedican a la crianza de animales y agricultura pero a pesar de todo no han dejado su cultura y tradiciones. Su gente es amable, gentil que día a día ven la manera de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hogares.

Doña Rosa Tiene 52 años, es divorciada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  mayores de edad, tres de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, solo su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre pero independiente.

La Señora Rosa se dedica a la venta confites en su local que es propio y esta sutuado en un sector comercial de la ciudad, esta actividad la desempeña desde hace 13 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de dulces para su exigente clientela.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the "Mujeres Floreciendo" communal bank for four years.  During this time she has developed strong friendships and a spirit of comradeship with all the members.  Rosa lives in the Valle parish of Cuenca, a place where the architecture is a mix of adobe houses and modern buildings.  The parish has seen substantial growth and been pushed forward due to business in the area.  The local industries are raising animals and agriculture but, in spite of everything, the area has not left behind its culture and traditions.  The people of Valle are friendly and kind and every day they look for a way of improving their quality of life at home.

Rosa is 52 years old.  She is divorced but she had four children when she was married, all of whom are now adults.  Three of her children work and help Rosa financially.  Only the last son is studying at a college in the city,  She does not have her own house so lives in her mother's house.  She is independent, though.

Rosa makes a living selling sweets from her own promises, situated in one of the city's shopping districts.  She has been doing this work for 13 years, working seven days a week with no fixed hours.

Her loan will be invested in buying sweets for her demanding customers.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Nuevos Senderos  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevos Senderos está formado por 9 mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y sacar  adelante a sus familias, las socias son mujeres amables, gentiles y carismáticas que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por la ciudad de Cuenca lugar que goza de diferentes lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, de la arquitectura colonial, de su  gastronomía y el calor de su gente. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Etelvina, está realizando su primer crédito en el banco comunal Nuevos Senderos al cual fue  invitada por una vecina quien ya es socia hace algún tiempo, vive por la comunidad de Narancay en la ciudad de Cuenca.

Doña Etelvina tiene 44 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos,  dos estudian en la universidad, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, uno de sus hijos solo se dedica a los estudios universitarios, sus tres últimos hijos son pequeños y  estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la minería, la casa en la que viven es propia.

La Señora. Etelvina se dedica al cuidado de su familia, pero desde hace 2 meses vende café orgánico que es muy bueno para la salud, en este negocio poco a poco va obtenido mas clientela. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y a sembrar hortalizas. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de café para su nuevo negocio. 

Su meta  crecer su negocio.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Senderos communal bank has nine enterprising women members who fight every day to improve the economic stability of their homes and to move their families forward. The members are nice, charismatic women who still maintain the culture and traditions of their people. They live in the city of Cuenca, where there are different places to enjoy nature, colonial architecture, its cuisine and the warmth of its people. 

One of the members in this group is Etelvina. She is making her first loan with the Nuevos Senderos communal bank. She was invited by a neighbor who has been a member for some time. She lives in the Narancay community in the city of Cuenca. 

Etelvina is 44 years old, married and she has six children. Two children are studying at the university. They work and help her economically. One of her children is only studying at the university. Her three other children are young and study at a school in the city. Her husband works in the mining industry. The house where they live is their own. 

Etelvina takes care of her family but two months ago, she started selling organic coffee which is very good for one’s health.  Little by little, this business has gained more customers. At her house, she raises chickens and plants vegetables. 
Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of coffee for her new business. 

Her goal is to grow her business. 

The small photo is of one of the members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: purchase coffee.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es: El Señor Genaro, es una persona de 59 años de edad, de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, cuenta con dos dependientes económicos a cargo, los cuales son su hijo y nieto. La actividad económica a la que se dedica el señor Genaro es la producción agrícola, de tal forma produce, papa 200 cargas, haba (grano) 36 Arrobas, maíz (grano) 3 cargas, avena (forraje), la producción se desarrolla en sus propios terrenos, los terrenos mencionados no cuentan con riego, y están ubicados en la comunidad de Iluri Grande, al norte del municipio de Tiraque a una distancia de quince km de la población de Tiraque.  A su vez se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros con destino de Colomi Cochabamba y viceversa, por otro lado el señor Genaro manifiesta ser una persona trabajadora y responsable que quiere superarse económicamente en la vida y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para compra de un motor  para su vehículo, de tal forma poder mejorar sus ingresos por lo tanto también la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en:
Genaro is fifty-nine years old and is married.  He studied through primary school, and has two economic dependents in his care, one of which is his son and the other is his grandson.  Genaro makes a living in agricultural production.  He produces two hundred 100 lb loads of potatoes, thirty-six 25 lb sacks of beans, three 100 lb loads of corn, and oats.  He does this on his own lands; these lands don't have irrigation systems, and they are located in the community called Lluri Grande, which is north of the town of Tiraque (about 15km away).  

At the same time, he makes a living in a transportation service of passengers to and from Colomi Cochabamba.  

Genaro makes it clear that he is a hardworking and responsible person who wants to better himself economically in life.  For this purpose, he is in need of investment capital in order to buy an engine for his vehicle.  In this way, he will be able to improve his income and therefore the quality of life of his dependents.

loans.use: to buy an engine.

loans.name: Cruz Carmelina

texts.es:
La Señora Cruz  desde hace 10 años ingreso al banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, en donde ha formado una nueva familia con sus compañeras y amigas del grupo quienes se  caracterizan por el compañerismo y solidaridad. Vive por la parroquia de Paccha en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, por su geografía accidentada cuenta con varios lugares para visitar y disfrutar, su gente es amable, gentil y muy trabajadora, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Cruz tiene 58 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  mayores de edad, uno de sus hijos es casado y vive independiente, su otro hijo estudia y trabaja. Su esposo presta sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, la casa en la que viven es de propia.

La Señora Cruz desde hace 7 años se dedica la venta de confites y desde hace 4 años también vende ropa, su mercadería la vende recorriendo la ciudad de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cerdos y pollos.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y alimento para sus animales. 

Su sueño es conocer los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Cruz joined the "Mujeres Floreciendo" communal bank ten years ago.  There, her colleagues and friends have become like another family, with a spirit of comradeship and support.  Cruz lives in the Paccha parish in Cuenca.  A place with a cold climate, Paccha's hills give you plenty of places to visit and enjoy.  The people are friendly, kind and very hard-working.  They still maintain the culture and traditions of the towns.

Cruz is 58 years old, married and has two children.  They are both now adults.  One is married and independent while the other is studying and working.  Cruz's husband is a security guard.  They live in their own house.

Cruz has been selling sweets for seven years and for four years now she has also been selling clothes.  She sells her merchandise all over the city, seven days a week, with no fixed working hours.  Back at home, she raises pigs and chickens.

Her new loan will be invested in buying clothes and in feed for her animals.

Her dream is to travel to the US.

loans.use: to buy clothes and feed for animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to grow bananas.

loans.name: Emeterio

texts.es: El Señor Emeterio tiene 56 años, vive con su esposa Genaria en la comunidad de Chacjrapampa del Cantón Pedernal del municipio de Monteagudo. Ellos se dedican a la producción y venta de maíz amarillo y blando en sus terrenos que tienen, cultivando 4 hectáreas de ambos variedades de maíz, como también crían cerdos mejorados en sus corrales rústicos que tienen. Son de estas  actividades agrícolas y pecuarias que obtienen ingresos  para cubrir sus gastos de estudios, ropa, alimentación y otros que tienen sus hijos y también ellos, es por eso que ellos  están solicitando crédito para la compra de agroquímicos y así tener de alimento para sus cerdos como también para poder vender, es por eso que quieren obtener  ingresos para continuar haciendo estudiar a sus hijos hasta culminar  sus estudios secundarios y así tener un trabajo y mejores condiciones de  vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Emeterio, 56, lives with his wife Genaria in the community of Chacjrapampa, Pedernal canton, municipality of Monteagudo. They grow corn (yellow and white) in four hectares they own, and sell it. They also raise pigs in some rustic pens they have.

These activities are their source of income and how they pay for their family’s clothes and food and for their children’s education.

This is why they are requesting a loan to buy agrochemicals and feed for their pigs, in order to receive more income and be able to continue paying for their children’s education. Once they graduate from high school, they will have more job opportunities and will be able to improve their life conditions.

loans.use: to buy agrochemicals for his crops.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
La señora Olga Marina esta soltera, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian, cursó los 2 años de educacion media, se dedica a la elaboración de costuras, delantales, gabachas, etc; inicio este trabajo por iniciativa propia, hasta ahora lleva 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de telas e hilos, ya que quiere incrementar su produccion, mejorar sus ingresos y seguir apoyando a su familia en los gastos de la familia. Espera en el futuro tener una maquila y de esa forma seguirá prosperando, y tener empleados.
texts.en:
Sonia Patricia is single, 37-years-old, and has 4 children whom are all in school.  She completed 2 years of middle school and works as a seamstress.  She also makes aprons and gabachas (traditional work shirts), among other things.

She started this business through her own initiative and by this point has 7 years of experience.  She has the support of her family.

She is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy fabric and needles, since she wants to increase her production, improve her profits, and continue helping her family in the family expenses.  She hopes in the future to have a sewing machine and in this way continue to progress and obtain employees.

loans.use: Comprar telas e hilos

loans.name: Daniel Arturo

texts.es: Daniel es un muchacho joven y emprendedor estudiante de la carrera de Auditoria, padre de una pequeña niña a quien asistente mensualmente, además de verla y compartir con ella todo el tiempo que pueda. Actualmente vive en la casa de su padre, con quien comparte los gastos de la casa. Trabaja como consultor, porque todavía no es profesional y eso hace que él no sea considerado empleado de planta, sin embargo ya lleva 3 años con su actividad que le da la posibilidad de tener un ingreso mensual para poder costear sus estudios y también pagar sus obligaciones. Desde muy joven siempre trabajo, y con sus anteriores trabajos logro ahorrar para comprarse un terreno el cual ahora necesita amurallar y luego poder construir y tener una casa propia donde vivir, también con la idea de formar su hogar, casarse y llevar a vivir a esa casa  a su esposa y su pequeña hija. Tiene grandes aspiraciones y se nota en él que es una persona bastante emprendedora.
texts.en: Daniel is a young, enterprising man who is studying accounting. He is the father of a young daughter whom he helps every month, and whom he sees and shares with as often as possible. Right now, he lives with his father, with whom he shares household expenses. He works as a consultant, but he is still not licensed and that means he is considered an employee still. Nonetheless, he has been doing this activity for 3 years to pay for his schooling and fulfill his responsibilities. He has worked since he was very young and with his previous jobs was able to save and buy a plot of land which is needs to wall off and and later be able to build a house to take his wife and daughter to live there. He has big dreams and it is evident that he is a very enterprising person.

loans.use: to build on some land.

loans.name: Norberto Alonso

texts.es: El Sr. Norberto nativo de la Comunidad de San Andrés es una persona de condición muy humilde pero trabajador, según referencias de vecinos de la comunidad; lleva más de 18 años en el rubro de la agricultura por lo que tiene gran experiencia en la agricultura ya que desde muy joven comenta desempeñar esta actividad ya que las condiciones económicas le exigieron independizarse e incursionar en la actividad que hoy en día representa su principal fuente de trabajo, es así que solo curso hasta la primaria; de estado civil casado, cuentan con una vivienda la misma que está ubicada en la Comunidad de San Andrés. El crédito que hoy solicita es para poder comprar insumos para la producción de papa y así poder aprovechar la época de siembra para así poder obtener mayores ingresos indicando que el crédito le será de gran ayuda para poder concretar otros sueños que este tiene para con su familia.
texts.en: Norberto is a native of the community of  San Andrés. He is a humble but very hardworking person, according to references from residents of the community. He has been working in agriculture for more than 18 years and so he has a lot of agricultural experience.He has been doing this activity since he was very young, because financial conditions required him to become independent and go into this activity that today is his main source of income. That is why he only went to primary school. He is married and they have a house located in the community of San Andrés. The loan he is asking for today is to be able to buy materials to grow potatoes so he can take advantage of the planting season and obtain more income. He says that this loan will be a big help with other dreams he has for his family.

loans.use: to buy potato growing materials.

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en: A diligent local farmer from the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Na is 52 years old and blessed with seven children. Currently, only one child still depends on her as he is still in school. To earn money for their daily basic needs, she grows rice on two hectares. To supplement the family income, her husband works as a carpenter, making chairs, tables, cabinets, etc. The current business earns her about 22,000 KHR per day. Including this cycle, she is a third time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loans have improved her living condition progressively, and she also has paid back the entire past loans with success. Now, she is in a group of three in order to apply for a new loan. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes to re-plant her cash-crop on time so that she can make more profit to buy an additional plot of farmland for growing more rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en: Age 56 and a rural villager from Ek Phnom district of Battambang Province, Phorn is also a father of eight children. Currently, some of his children are still in school and some are helping in the family’s business. He is a peasant who grows rice and soybeans as a primary source of income in order to cover the daily cost of living for the rest of his family. Phorn has been engaged in this business for several years. Now, he is in need of working capital in order to be ready for the replanting period in the upcoming dry season. Therefore, he formed a group of two in order to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. This is the third loan for Phorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has paid back his loans completely and it enabled him to sustain his living and improve his livelihood gradually. This cycle, he is seeking 1,000,000 KHR and his co-borrower is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As a group leader, he will spend his loan portion to purchase potash and to pay the plowing fee. He hopes to grow his rice seasonally and get back a good yield to maintain his lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase potash and to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en: Savoeurn is a citizen from Kampong Cham Province’s Dambae district. She is 31 years old and has three schoolchildren under her dependency. To provide her children with daily decent food, she manages a rice farm and a cassava field together with her husband. It is the business that she has been involved with for 10 years. This is the fourth loan for Savoeurn with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has managed to use the past loans wisely in order to reduce the family’s hardships and improve her standard of living. Now, she is applying for a new loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for labor fees. She hopes to grow both cash crops fruitfully and healthily so she can sustain her living condition and keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay labor fees

loans.name: Erick

texts.es: El joven Erick, tiene 22 años, le falta tres años para culminar con sus estudios en el colegio, no termino por falta de recursos económicos por parte de su madre que es viuda y por falta de orientación, ya que tubo una mala influencia de sus amigos. Empezó a trabajar hace dos años como albañil, vive en la casa de su madre junto a sus hermanos en la zona de Sacaba - Cochabamba- Bolivia, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Actualmente trabaja con un contratista de albañil y tienen varios contratos para construcción de casas. De los ingresos que percibe como albañil, es destinado para colaborar con los gastos de la familia y para su ahorro. El joven Erick solicita el crédito para la compra de una mezcladora, ya que actualmente ellos se alquilan a un costo muy elevado, por lo que pretende comprar la mezcladora para alquilar a su jefe pero a un costo mas bajo y así tener un ingreso mayor.
texts.en:
The Young Erick is 22 years old. He needs three years to finish with his studies in school. He did not finish because of the lack of economic resources on his widowed mother’s part and a lack of direction since his friends were bad influences. He began to work two years ago as a construction worker. He lives in his mother’s house with his siblings in the Sacaba zone of Cochabamba, Bolivia. He is single and he does not have children. 

Currently he works with a construction contractor and they have various contracts for home construction. From the income that he receives as a construction worker, he intends to contribute to the family expenses and to save money. The young Erick requests the loan for the purchase of a mixer, since currently they rent one at a very elevated cost. He intends to buy the mixer to rent to his boss at a lower cost and therefore have a higher income.

loans.use: to buy a mixer.

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en: Phoeurn, 56, is a mother of six children. She is a resident from Kampong Cham Province. For her family, the main source of their income is from three hectares of rice growing. This is the business that she has been engaged in for 36 years and she is able to earn up to 23,000 KHR per day.  Now, she is seeking a first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use this loan to buy a mini plowing machine in order to support her rice cropping business. She hopes that this purchase will help her to reduce the plowing fee that she used to pay and use that money to support her living instead.

loans.use: To buy a mini plowing machine

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Auk's Group

texts.en: A married woman from Kampong Cham Province, Auk is 62 years old and also a farmer. On two hectares of rice cultivation farmland, she manages to earn up to 30,000 KHR per day and is able to save up to 10,000 KHR per day. Her past loan, which she has fully repaid back, was her original loan. This loan has enabled her to expand her current business at a gradual pace. Now, she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. For this cycle, she is seeking 2,000,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy necessary materials to build her house. She hopes to own a decent house for her family.

loans.use: to rebuild her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Leangheng

texts.en: Leangheng is 43 years old and a mother of three kids who are still in school. To make a living, she has been growing rice on two hectares of farmland for 20 years and is able to earn up to 30,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Leangheng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her cash-cropbusiness. She hopes this purchase will help her to grow her rice on a larger scale and return her double yield.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her cash-crop business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Savann's Group

texts.en:
Savann, age 55 and a widow living in Kampong Cham Province, is a farmer who grows rice on a hectare as her primary source of income. She sells grocery items in the area for supplementary income. For the 37 years that she has been involved in this business, she is able to earn up to 30,000 riels (KHR) per day. 

Savann has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three cycles. Her living conditions have improved gradually with her past loans, which she has repaid with success. Now, she is in a group of four members applying for a new loan. The total amount of the group loan is 5,400,000 KHR. Savann is going to use her loan portion of 1,400,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to grow her paddy rice on time and make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Srors' Group

texts.en: Srors is 33 years old and a rural villager from the Prey Chor district of Kampong Cham province. She has two children to provide for as they are still in school. To deal with daily food consumption, she grows rice and sells grocery items. The 12 years of experience she has in her current business enables her to earn up to 18,500 KHR per day. For her, lacking working capital is the main challenge for her business. To overcome this challenge, she formed a group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid back completely, has enabled her to keep up a good pace of her living and she also manages to buy additional household assets from her profits including a television, cabinet, chair, a table etc. Now, she and her fellow group member are seeking 1,200,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she is going to spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and grocery items for resale. She hopes to make more income from her business so that she can keep both of her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and grocery items for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Thoeurn is 48 years old and has two children. She is a resident of Prey Chor district of Kampong Cham province. Thoeum grows rice on one and a half hectare of farmland. From the current business, she is able to earn up to 19,500 KHR a day. 

Thoeum is short on working capital to support her farmland. She formed a group of two to apply for a loan from VisionFund (her third loan and the first loan for her fellow group member).  They are requesting a loan for 1,000,000 KHR each, which Thoeum will use to purchase potash and rice seed and pay for a plowing fee. She hopes to grow her rice on time and fruitfully, so she can get triple yield with a good income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase potash and rice seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chanthoeun's Group

texts.en: Chanthoeun is 42 years old and one of the breadwinners in a family with four children. To sustain her daily cost of living, she does rice cropping on one and a half hectares of farmland. Besides helping on the farmland, her husband also works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been involved in this business for 20 years, and she is able to earn up to 15,200 KHR per day. Chanthoeun has never been with VisionFund before. Now, she is in the first microloan group consisting of two female members. Each of them are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR. As a group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to lease a plot of farmland to grow cassava for extra income. She hopes to gain more yield from both of her cash crops so that she can make more income for her family.

loans.use: To lease a plot of farmland to grow cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sok Ran

texts.en:
Sok Ran, 49 years old, is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is also a garment worker who earns $4 each day. Three of Sok Ran's children are employed, earning about $9 per day.

Due to lack of funds, Sok Ran is requesting a loan of $1,400 to purchase timber to fix her house. This money will help her make her house much stronger and provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, Sok Ran would like to run an additional business to generate more income to financially support the family.

loans.use: to purchase timber to fix her house

loans.name: Pom

texts.en:
Pom is 33 and married, with two dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, earning a living farming rice and planting cassava, while her husband works as a laborer to help earn income to support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR50,000 per day from the current business.

This is the third microloan for Pom with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She successfully used the previous loans to better her living conditions. Now she is applying for a loan of KHR2,000,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava planting. She hopes to make more cassava, as well as rice, and sell it for a good price so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava planting.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom, 55, is married with three children. They reside in a rural village of the Thmor Koul District of Battambang Province. To support the family, Sokhom and her husband have been farming rice for 15 years. Together, they can earn about 25,000 riels (KHR) per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Sokhom has been with VisionFund for one cycle, while the other member has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Sokhom used her previous loan to better support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sokhom is going to use her portion to buy one motor for commuting in her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to better her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy one motor for commuting in her family

loans.name: Roeurn's Group

texts.en:
Roeurn, 56, is married with nine children, residing in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. She has nine children, one of whom is independent and works for others for a fee. 

For the last ten years, Roeurn has been farming rice as a primary source of the family’s income. She can earn about KHR 25,000 per day.

Roeurn’s Group consists of two members who live in the same village. Roeurn has been a member of VisionFund Cambodia for six cycles already and has completely paid back the prior loans. The past loans from VisionFund Cambodia have helped Roeurn better support her family and also her current business. 

Now, leading her group to apply for a loan, Roeurn, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on pumping water into her cultivated land. She hopes to increase her crop yield, so as to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for and pump water into her farmland.

loans.name: Kimyoern's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Kimyoern is 33 years old and married with two children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 10 years, Kimyoern can earn about 25,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the first loan for Kimyoern’s group of two members. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy cows to raise to earn additional income. She hopes to increase her crop yield and feed her cows well so that they will become fat and healthy and help improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cows to raise to earn additional income.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn, 33, lives in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district. He is single. 

To earn a living, he has been farming rice for five years. To complement the income from rice farming, he also raises pigs. The current business earns him about 20 US$ per day but he can manage to save about 10 US$ each day after daily expenses. 

Sokhorn is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. He is applying for a loan. With this loan, he will buy pig feed to nourish them. He hopes that this loan will enable him to fatten his pigs so that he can sell them for a high price to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pig feed to nourish them

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
A villager from the Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district, Som is 24 years old and married. She has one dependent son, who is still small. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming. To better support her family, Som also sells grocery items to earn additional income. Having been in this business for four years, she is able to earn a daily income of US $7 to support her family, and she can save about US $5 per day for their future needs.
 
This is the first loan for Som with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy a motor for commuting for her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent motor for her family's use.

loans.use: To buy a motor for commuting for her family

loans.name: Noern

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Kror Kor district, Noern is aged 56 years and married with 10 children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and raise pigs to support their family. To supplement the income, her husband also works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for several years, Noern manages to earn about 15,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and can save about 5,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Noern has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. She successfully paid back the past loans. Now she is applying for another with VisionFund of 2,000,000 KHR to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to expand her current business so as to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Sarun, a 43-year-old married woman residing in a rural village of the Pursat Province’s Kror Kor District, has eight children. Four children are dependent on her and still in school. She earns a living by planting rice and various kinds of vegetables. Having been in this business for ten years, she can earn about 20,000 riels (KHR) per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Sarun has just started with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to earn more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Paula Eugenia

texts.es:
Paula tiene 33 años de edad. Asegura que su mayor bendición es su familia. 
Desde hace 5 años cuenta con una miscelánea, en la cual presta servicios de fotocopias, impresiones y venta de accesorios.
Desde hace 6 meses su esposo se encuentra desempleado, razón por la cual esta mujer ha tenido que tomar las riendas del hogar y sostener la educación de su hijo de 11 años de edad.
Su mayor dificultad es el hurto de mercancía de la cual esta mujer ha sido víctima desde hace meses atrás, debido a que su negocio no cuenta con las mínimas normas de seguridad, su local está construido en madera, situación que la hace más vulnerable. Por esta razón 	Paula se encuentra solicitando un  crédito para realizar mejoras locativas y construir su negocio de material. De esta manera será más agradable al público y está convencida que sus ingresos mejorarán lo que permitirá obtener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Paula, 33, asserts that her family is her biggest blessing.  For five years she has had a shop where she makes photocopies and printouts and sells accessories.  Her husband has been unemployed for six months, so this woman has had to take charge of the household and pay for her 11-year-old child's education.

Her biggest difficulty is the theft of merchandise that she has been subject to for several months because her business doesn't have basic security standards.  Her store is built of wood, which makes it more vulnerable.

This is why Paula's requesting a loan to make improvements to her space and build her business of adobe and cement materials.  This way it will be more pleasing to the public.  She's also convinced that her income will improve, allowing her to get a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to build her store of adobe and cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooler.

loans.name: Nelis Nohemy

texts.es:
La señora Nelis de 28 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en su casa  de habitación junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en  un  municipio, al sur de Honduras. Se dedica desde hace más de 5 años al negocio que es la venta de Hamacas de hilo, hamacas de seda, hamacas de lazo, de todos los tipos y tamaños.
Doña Nelis sus ventas son diarias de lunes a domingo, sus clientes son las personas que viajan hacia la capital de Honduras porque  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en la orilla de la pavimentada que conduce hacia la capital de la república.
Doña Nelis está solicitando el préstamo  para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de hamacas como hilos de seda, lazos, agujas, etc. Para surtir más su negocio. 
Doña Nelis con el apoyo del préstamo desea mejorar un poco sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, su deseo es seguir trabajando con Prisma para el futuro mejorar su casa. 

San Lorenzo,  Honduras - Enero del 2013
texts.en:
Nelis is 28 years old, married, with two children. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. This is located in a town in southern Honduras. For the past five years she has been selling cotton, silk and rope hammocks of all sizes and types. 
She sells her hammocks daily, from Monday to Sunday. Her customers are people who travel to the capital of Honduras, as her business is located on the road to the capital of the Republic. 
Mrs. Nelis is asking for this loan in order to buy the materials needed to make hammocks, such as silk thread, rope, needles, etc. She would like to provide a greater variety of goods for her business. 

San Lorenzo,  Honduras - January, 2013

loans.use: to buy silk thread, rope, scissors, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Groupement  Ngima Roog

texts.fr: Le groupement "NGIMA ROOG"  se compose de trois femmes toutes mariées.Elles sont des ménagères qui s'occupent des travaux domestiques et de l'entretien de leurs enfants.Depuis quelques mois, elles se sont lancées dans le commerce de produits céréaliers.Ce commerce leur a permis d'améliorer la prise en charge de leurs propres besoins celle des dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles respectives. Le chef du groupe (à gauche avec le foulard maron) est mère de quatre enfants. Elle tient une table au marché du village et vend des condiments. Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 300000f pour acheter du mil et de l'arachide.
texts.en:
The Ngima Roog group has three female members, all of whom are married. They are housewives, who carry out domestic duties and also look after their children. A few months ago they decided to start selling cereal products. This business has allowed them to improve the way in which they provide for themselves and cover the daily expenses of their respective families. 

The head of the group (on the left with the brown scarf) is a mother to four children. She has a table in the village market, where she sells seasonings. To increase their working capital, the group members have requested a loan of 300,000 francs to buy millet and peanuts.

loans.use: To buy millet, peanuts, and cattle.

loans.name: Lourdes Iris

texts.es:
La Señora Lourdes   de  37  años de edad, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio de San Lorenzo, al  sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 08  años al negocio de venta de carne con pollo, hamburguesas, tortitas de carne, sándwich, arroz con pollo,  etc. sus clientes son los amigos y familiares que le visitan a diario  en el mercado municipal.
Doña Lourdes es una señora emprendedora con deseos de superarse esta solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de mas productos para elaboras sus golosinas como se carne de pollo, res, repollo, lechuga, tomates, papas, cebollas, chiles, plátanos, queso, arroz, etc. Con el apoyo de este préstamo espera  que sus ventas aumentan un poco al tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes. 
Doña Lourdes de esta manera desea mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Doña Lourdes su sueño es terminar de hacer su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2013
texts.en:
Lourdes is 37 years old she lives in her own house which is located in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo, in the southern region of Honduras. For the past 8 years she has made a living running her own business, selling chicken, hamburgers, meat patties, sandwiches, rice with chicken, etc. Her customers are friends and family members who go to the municipal market daily. 

Lourdes is an entrepreneurial woman, with a strong desire to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy more supplies to be able to make the food she sells. She will buy chicken, beef, cabbage, lettuce, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, peppers, plantains, cheese and rice, among other things. She hopes that as a result of this loan her sales will increase, so that she can begin to offer a larger variety of items to her customers.   

Lourdes hopes to improve her quality of life, as well as that of her family. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma. Lourdes' greatest dream is to finish building her house.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras - January, 2013

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, cabbage, lettuce, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, peppers, plantains, cheese and rice, among other things, for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase meet, rice, chicken, beans, bread, spaghetti, sauces, sugar, ice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang is 47 years old and married. She is a mother of two children, both of whom are dependent on her. 

To make a living, Neang has been selling bread while her husband supplements the income by working for others for a fee, to better support her big family. They have been in business for three years. 

Neang’s Group consists of two female members who live in the same village in the Sangke district of Battambang province. Neang is in her fifth loan cycle while the other member is in just her first cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Neang will use her portion to buy more bread for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more bread for resale.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla is from a rural village of the Mongkul Borey district, Banteay Meanchey province. She is a 53-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. Raising pigs has been the only source of her family’s income to make a living for 30 years. Her husband helps to earn additional income, by working as a taxi driver. The current business earns her about 34,700 KHR per day.

Phalla has been with VisionFund for some past loan cycles, and she completely repaid her previous loans. The other member of Palla's Group has been with VisionFund for one previous cycle.

Now, Phalla is leading her group to request a new loan, of 1,000,000 KHR, each. Phalla, who is the group leader, will use her portion of the loan funds to buy piglets, and pig feed for nourishing them. She hopes this loan will enable her to fatten her pigs, so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed for nourishing them

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Roern's Group

texts.en:
Roern, 62, is a rural villager from Thmor Koul district, Battambang Province. She is the mother of eight children. To provide a decent daily living for her family, she and her husband manage three hectares of land area for growing rice. It is the business in which she has engaged for 15 years, and Roern is able to earn up to 24,600 KHR per day.

Six loans ago was Roern's original loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has successfully used her loans to upgrade her living standard in a good manner. Additionally, she can set aside some money for future needs.

Now, she is in need of working capital in order to take care of her farmland. So she formed a group of three, in order to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. She and one of her fellow group members are seeking to borrow 1,200,000 KHR each, while the remaining member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Roern, the group leader, is going to use her portion of the loan funds to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to boost her crop yield and get back a good profit for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Roum's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Sangke district, Roum is a 63-year-old father of four children. The main source of his family’s income is cultivating rice on five hectares of farmland, which he has been doing for 30 years. To better support his family and earn additional income, he also buys and sells cows in the local area. With his current business, he can earn about KHR 90,000 per day, and he manages to save about KHR 20,000 each day [22%], after daily living expenses. 

This is the fourth loan for Roum’s Group of two members, who are both males. They successfully repaid their previous loan with VisionFund. Now, Roum is leading his group to apply for a new loan. As the leader, he will use his portion of the loan funds to rent another plot of farmland, for growing rice. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his family’s income, so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To rent another plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Arco Iris” conformados por 14 comuneros, la gran mayoría vecinos de la zona. Hermenejildo es el tesorero del grupo, cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad, el tiene 53 años casado con 04 hijos independientes. Hermenejildo  junto a su esposa se dedican hace más de 20 años a la  ganadería a la  fecha ya está contando con más de 50 vacas producto de ellas prepara y vende queso. Se siente feliz pues con su arduo trabajo a podido comprar su propio terreno y sacar adelante a su familia. También nos comenta que piensa comprarse una moto para que lo trabaje uno de sus hijos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales y para el primer pago de la mototaxi. Su mayor deseo es de seguir  trabajando positivamente. Hermenejildo está ubicado en la parte posterior, es el cuarto del lado izquierdo  viste camisa azul y polo amarillo.
texts.en: This is the “Arco Iris” ["Rainbow"] group, made up of 14 community members, the great majority of them neighbors from the area. Hermenejildo is the group's treasurer, a duty he has carried out responsibly. He is 53 years old and married, with 4 children who are now independent. Hermenejildo and his wife have worked for more than 20 years in livestock raising. Currently, he has more than 50 cows, and from their production he makes and sells cheese. He feels happy, because through his hard work he has been able to buy his own land and help his family get ahead. He also comments that he is thinking about buying a moto-taxi [motorcycle with passenger attachment] so that one of his sons can work with it. He is requesting the loan to buy balanced feed for his animals, and to make the first payment on the moto-taxi. His greatest desire is to keep working in a positive direction. Hermenejildo is located in the back row; he is the fourth from the left, dressed in a blue shirt and yellow polo.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed and make the first payment on a moto-taxi.

loans.name: G.s Marcelino Group

texts.es:
La  joven  Wendy es una persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora vive con  su esposos y 2 hijos en una colonia de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es pulpería desde hace más de 2 años.
Wendy el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de refrescos, café, azúcar, pan, frijoles, arroz, manteca, salsas, pastas, huevos, churros, refrescos, etc. Con el préstamo espera  el aumento de las ventas debido a que contara con más producto que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan y así cubrir sus necesidades.
Wendy al igual que sus compañeras de grupo desea que su  situación económica mejore un poco, en unos años esperan  que sus negocios estén posicionados como uno de los más grandes y  reconocidos de sus colonias y poder seguir apoyando a  sus familias.
Doña Yesenia su negocio es una  compra y venta  de ropa  americana desde hace 5 años 
Doña Waleska su negocio es la  fábrica  de tortillas desde hace 3 años en la  colonia donde reside.



Choluteca, Honduras – Enero  del 2013
texts.en:
Wendy is an honest, responsible, and hardworking young woman who lives with her husband and two children in Choluteca, in the south of Honduras. She has a store that she has been operating for more than two years. 

Wendy is asking for this loan in order to buy soda, coffee, sugar, bread, beans, rice, cooking grease, sauces, pasta, eggs, and churros, among other things. With this loan she hopes to increase her sales given that she will have more products to offer the clients that visit her, thereby complying with their necessities. 

Wendy, as the other members of her lending group, hopes to improve her economic situation, and in a few years hopes that her business is positioned as one of the larger ones in her neighborhood. This way, she will be able to continue to support her family. 

The other members of the group, Yesenia and Waleska, also have their own businesses. Yesenia has been buying and selling American clothes for the past five years, and Waleska has been working making tortillas for the past three years.

loans.use: to buy soda, coffee, sugar, bread, beans, rice, cooking grease, sauces, pasta, eggs, churros, etc.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha, 37, lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battamabng province. She is married with four children, who are all still in school. The family’s main sources of income are from farming rice and her husband's fishing. She has been in this business for ten years. Her family’s daily income is about 20,000KHR per day. Sokha has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back her past loan, which helped to relieve her family's burden and improve their livelihood. To support her business, she is leading her group of two in this loan request. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland as well as to fund the plowing of the field. She hopes to increase her rice crop and sell it for a good price. Her dream is to run a new grocery business to earn more additional income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Saem's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Ek Phnom district of Cambodia, Saem is 52 years old and single. She earns a living through selling rice in the local area. Having been in this business for seven years, she is able to earn about KHR 90,000 per day, but she can manage to save about KHR 15,000 each day, after daily expenses. 
 
Saem’s Group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund Cambodia for five cycles. The previous loans helped Saem to better support her current business. Now she is leading her group, asking for a loan of KHR 1,400,000 for each member. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more rice for resale. She hopes to increase her income, so as to improve her family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more rice to resale.

loans.name: Sophay's Group

texts.en:
Sophay is 35 and married. She lives in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battabang province and she has one daughter who is still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and growing oranges for several years, earning about 72,000 KHR per day.
 
Sophay has been with VisionFund for six loans which she has completely paid back. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and for water pumping. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Marina's Group

texts.en:
At 33 years old, Marina is a single woman who lives in a rural village in the SangKe district. She earns a living by selling toys in the local area. She has been in this business for several years. This is the family's main source of income. The business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day. 

Marina has been with VisionFund for two cycles, while the other members of her group have been with VisionFund from four to six cycles. Marina completely repaid her previous loan. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy more toys for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business in order to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more toys for resale

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of two children, Sovann is 33 years old and lives in a rural village of the Sangke district in Cambodia. All of her children are dependent on her and still in school. To support her family, she and her husband farm rice on six hectares of land as the main source of the family’s income. They have been in this business for several years. 

Sovann has been with Kiva’s parter, VisionFund, for five cycles, while the other member of her group has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Sovann completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to expand her current business. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and spend a portion of it for water pumping. Sovann hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 46-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of two children; one of her sons is shown in the photo, who has been doing a business of jewelry-selling for the past three years. By this time, he has become famous for providing good-quality jewelry in his town. People like to buy from him for the special occasions of weddings and parties.

Kousar is also doing sewing as her part-time job. In this way, she is able to handle her family needs and requirements efficiently. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation and she is much satisfied with the support of it. 

Currently, Kousar has applied for a loan of PKR 15,000, so her son would be able to purchase more varieties of earrings, bracelets, and rings in different colors and designs to increase his sales. He expects a boost in his net income and wishes to spend part of it on the expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of earrings, bracelets, and rings for her son's jewelry business.

loans.name: Nanoor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement "Nanoor" qui signifie "entente"  en langue locale,se compose de six femmes toutes mariées. Elles exercent un commerce de denrées alimentaires dans les marchés hebdomadaires qui se tiennent le long de la semaine dans différents villages de leur région. Elles achètent en gros des denrées pour amoindrir le coût, se partagent les produits avant de les revendre séparément.Cette activité leur permet de subvenir à leurs propres besoins ainsi qu'à ceux de leurs familles. 

Le chef de groupe( en blanc) se nomme Ndamba, elle  est mère de trois enfants dont l'un fréquente l'école primaire.Elle exerce la même activité de commerce de denrées alimentaires que les autres femmes. 

Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 700 000f pour acheter des sacs de mil, de haricots et d'arachide.
texts.en:
The group called "Nanoor" which means "agreement" in the local language, is made up of six women all of whom are married. They sell food products in the weekly markets that are held throughout the week in different villages in the region. They buy the food wholesale to reduce the price, share out the products then resell them separately. This activity enables them to provide for themselves and their families. 

Ndamba (wearing white) is the group leader. She is the mother of three children. One of the children goes to elementary school. Like the other women, she sells food products. 

In order to enhance their businesses, they request a loan of 700,000F to purchase bags of millet, beans, and groundnut.

loans.use: to buy bags of millet, beans and groundnut.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa is 26 years old, married and resides in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She has one son. To support the family, she and her husband have been in the fishing and rice farming businesses for several years. The current business earns her family about 26,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Channa has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food. Now she is leading her group of two in seeking a loan. Channa will use her portion to buy materials for her fishing business. She hopes to increase her current fishing business to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lourdes Del Pilar

texts.es:
La Señera Lourdes  de 36  años de edad, tiene  5 hijos que dependan de ella,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una colonia de Tegucigalpa, en la zona centro Honduras, se dedica desde 18 años al negocio de venta de golosinas en una escuela de su comunidad.
Doña Lourdes sus clientes son los alumnos de una escuela donde tiene su negocio y también sus amigos y vecinos de la colonia donde vive, espera que con los ingresos que obtenga poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Lourdes está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de repollo, chiles, carne de pollo, res, plátanos, tortillas, pan, salsas, papas, yucas, etc.  Para tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes que a diario le comprar este tipo de productos.
Doña Lourdes su sueño es que en un futuro su negocio sea más grande y que sus hijos se gradúen para que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida, está contenta de seguir trabando con Prisma.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras - Enero del 2013.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 36, and her husband have five children and they all live in a residential area in Tegucigalpa, in central Honduras.  For 18 years she has been selling snacks at the community school.  Her customers are students, friends and neighbors.  She hopes to use her income to give her family a better lifestyle.

Lourdes is requesting a loan to buy cabbage, peppers, chicken, beef, bananas, tortillas, bread, sauces, potatoes, yucca plant, etc.  This is to have on hand the daily products her customers request.

Her goal is to expand her business so her children can graduate from school and have better opportunities in life.  She is happy to continue working with Prisma.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras - January, 2013.

loans.use: To buy food for her business.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
La Señera Rosmery  de 29  años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos que dependan de ella,  tiene casa propia que se encuentra en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en la zona centro Honduras, se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de achinería y costura.
Doña Rosmery  se dedica desde hace dos años a este negocio generador de ingresos, sus clientes son sus amigos y vecinos de la colonia donde vive, espera que con los ingresos que obtenga poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Rosmery  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de sombras, polvos, glases, colas, llaveros, cameras, lápiz de ojo, etc. Para tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes que le piden este tipo de productos.
Doña Rosmery  su sueño es que en un futuro su negocio sea más grande y que sus hijos se gradúen para que tengan mejores opotunidades, está contenta de seguir trabando con Prisma.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras - Enero del 2013.
texts.en:
Rosmery, 29, is single and has three children in her care.  She owns her home which is in a neighborhood of Tegucigalpa, in central Honduras.  For two years she has been selling sewing materials and cosmetics.

She earns an income selling to her friends and neighbors in the community.  Her aim is to improve her family's quality of life.

Rosmery is requesting a loan to buy eyeshadow, powder, glitter, glue, keychains, eyeliner, etc. to have a wider variety of products to offer customers.

Rosmery's goal is to expand her business so her children can graduate and have better opportunities.  She is happy to continue working with Prisma.



Tegucigalpa, Honduras - January, 2013.

loans.use: To buy eye shadow, powder, glitter, glue, keychains, eyeliner, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Ms Suriya, a 35-year-old married mother of two children, has been manufacturing auto rickshaw body parts for many years. She is doing it with the support of her husband, who purchases scrap rickshaws and, after renovating them, sells them in the local market.

Suriya has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. With a good repayment history, she has requested her sixth loan of Rs. 50,000 to purchase new tires and buckets of paint. She wishes to use part of her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and buckets of paint.

loans.name: G.s Los Angelitos#3 Group

texts.es:
La Señora  Gledis es una persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora vive con  sus  hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la Compra y venta de gallinas. 
Doña Gledis el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de gallinas. Con el préstamo espera  que sus ventas  aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan a diario y así cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia.
Doña Gledis en unos años sueña con que su negocio este posicionado como uno de los más grandes y  reconocidos de la zona y así poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.
Doña Gledis al igual que sus compañeras de grupo desean que su calidad de vida y la de sus familias mejoren un poco con esta inversión. 
Doña Sabina  tiene 45 años de edad  su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 10 años 
Doña Luz  tiene 51 años de edad su negocio es la compra  y venta de gallinas desde hace 15 años en los diferente caseríos cercanos a su comunidad.




Choluteca, Honduras – Enero  del 2013
texts.en:
Gledis is an honest, responsible, hard-working person who lives with her children in a community in Choluteca, in the south of Honduras.  Her business is buying and selling hens.  

Gledis needs this loan to buy hens.  She believes that the loan will help her to increase her sales as she will have more products available to offer the customers who visit her every day.  In this way, she will be able to cover her own needs as well as those of her family.

Gledis dreams that, in a few years time, her business will be well positioned as one of the biggest and most well-known in her area.  This will enable her to continue supporting her children so that they become upstanding citizens with better opportunities in life.

Gledis and her fellow group members hope that their own quality of life and that of their families will improve a little as a result of this investment.

Sabina is 45 years old and has been running a grocery store for 10 years.  Luz is 51 years old and has been buying and selling hens for 15 years in a number of small neighboring villages.  

Choluteca, Honduras - January 2013

loans.use: to buy hens for her business

loans.name: Rasolaan

texts.en:
Ms Rasoolan, a 53-year-old married mother of five children, is an expert at making ice cream at home, and enjoys a solid reputation for her product's taste and quality. Her son assists her by selling it to the people of their community.

In order to purchase cartons of milk and packs of flavors, Rasoolan has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. The loan will enable her to expand her sales and thus generate more cash. This will be her third loan, and she has demonstrated excellent past repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of milk and packs of flavors to make ice cream.

loans.name: Attiya

texts.en:
Attiya is a 28-year-old, vigorous woman. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons, to create a means of increasing revenues, so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her second loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf Foundation for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy for her sewing business more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Katerine Yaneth

texts.es:
La Joven Katerine de 23  años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos que dependan de ella,  vive en casa de sus padres, en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en la zona centro Honduras, se dedica desde hace unos meses a la venta de ropa interior, perfumes y lociones.
Katerine termino sus estudios y decidió comenzar con este negocio, sus clientes son sus amigos y vecinos de la colonia donde vive, vende al contado y al crédito.
Katerine está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de blúmeres, brasieres, perfumes, lociones, aretes, cremas y glases, espera con los ingresos que obtenga poder salir adelante y mejorar un poco su calidad de vida.
Katerine su sueño es que en un futuro su negocio sea más grande y está contenta por la oportunidad que PRISMA le ofrece.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras - Enero del 2013.
texts.en:
Katerine, 23, is single and has no children.  She lives with her parents in a neighborhood of Tegucigalpa, in central Honduras, and has been selling underwear, perfumes and lotions for several months.

Katerine finished her education and decided to set up her own business.  Her customers are friends and neighbors in the community.  She sells on both a cash and credit basis.

Katerine is requesting a loan to buy panties, bras, perfumes, lotions, earrings, creams and nail polish.  Her aim is to use her income to get ahead and improve her lifestyle.

Katerine's goal for the future is to expand her business.  She is very grateful to PRISMA for this opportunity.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras - January, 2013.

loans.use: To buy panties, bras, perfumes, lotions, earrings, creams and nail polish for her business.

loans.name: Nhor's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Nhor is aged 62 years and married. He has struggled to feed his family by farming rice and planting cassava. Having been in the business for 15 years, the current business earns him approximately 20,600 KHR per day. 

Nhor has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles and he completely paid back the loans. The loans have helped him to support his family’s living conditions. Now he is leading his group to apply for a loan. As the leader, he wants to use his portion to pay for labor costs of planting cassava. He hopes this loan will enable him to get a high yield from his cassava and rice so as to sell it for a good price to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs of planting cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor  Víctor de 53 años de edad es  casado,  vive con su esposa  y sus dos hijos de 25 y 28 años de edad en su casa de habitación en un barrio de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras,  se dedica desde hace  18 años al comercio.
Don Víctor su negocio es la venta de camarones y actualmente cuenta con una pulpería y un deposito de agua sus cliente son todos los vecinos del barrio y también tiene cliente de lugares fuera del municipio, des tribuye agua  en sus dos vehículos  a diferentes pulpería de las aldeas.
