Don Víctor está solicitando el préstamo  para compra  de agua, azúcar, leche, quesos, café, pan, arroz, frijoles, refrescos, etc.  Y con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende tener  mejores ganancias para mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Don Víctor su sueño  es tener una bodega distribuidora.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2013.
texts.en:
Víctor, 53, is married and lives with his wife and two children, ages 25 and 28, in the San Lorenzo neighborhood in southern Honduras.  For 18 years he has been working as a merchant.

Víctor sells shrimp and also runs a grocery store and water deposit.  His customers are neighbors in the community and people from other towns.  He distributes water and groceries to different villages using his two vehicles.

Víctor is requesting a loan to buy water, sugar, milk, cheeses, coffee, bread, rice, beans, soft drinks, etc.  He hopes to be able to use the loan to improve his income and his family's lifestyle.

Víctor's goal is to become a large distributor one day.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - January, 2013.

loans.use: To buy water, sugar, milk, cheese, coffee, bread, rice, beans, soft drinks, shrimp, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Orn is aged 59 years and widowed. The main source of her family’s income is from cassava planting which she has been doing for 10 years to make a living. She is able to earn from her current business about 23,000 KHR per day and she manages to save 10,000 KHR each day. 

Orn’s group consists of three members and she has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She’s successfully used the past loans to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. Orn, who is the leader, will use her portion to pay labor costs of cassava planting. She hopes to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To pay for the labor costs of cassava planting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha, 56, is from a rural village located in the Tbaung Khmum district, Kampong Cham province. She is married and has two children. She and her husband earn a living by selling food in the local area. Together, they have been in this business for 10 years. 

This is Tha's third microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely repaid the past loans, which helped her to better support her family. Now she is leading her group of five, to ask for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her portion of the loan funds to buy more food to resell. Tha hopes to increase the income from her current business, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more food to resell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Balcon Florido Group

texts.es: Buenas tardes: “Balcon Forido” es  uno de los grupos más antiguo, que en el transcurso del tiempo nos han demostrado responsabilidad y compañerismo entre ellos, y está conformado por 09 socios. Idelfonza de 56 años es casada y tiene 05 hijos independientes. Hace muchos años que se dedica a la venta de queso,  este negocio lo realiza a pedidos la cual lo distribuye  en tiendas, mercados y vecinos de la zona, fruto de esfuerzo es que ha podido mejorar su vivienda. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de quesos y así poder entregar sus pedidos. Si siguiente meta es de instalar una panadería en un lugar céntrico, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. Idelfonza es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo celeste. El grupo “Balcon Florido” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito
texts.en:
Good evening: "Balcón Florido" [Balcony with flowers], composed of nine members, is one of the oldest groups, and has shown to be responsible and full of good friends. 

Idelfonza, 56, is married and has five independent children. For many years, she has been selling cheese upon request, distributing to stores, marketplaces and among her neighbors. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to improve her house.

She will use the loan to buy cheese and be able to deliver all the orders placed by her customers. Her goal for the future is to open a bakery in a central location, which she is sure will result in better profits. In the picture, Idelfonza is located to the left and is wearing a light-blue t-shirt. “Balcón Florido” wants to thank the people that made this loan possible.

loans.use: to buy cheese to sell.

loans.name: Keat's Group

texts.en:
Keat, age 19, is a married mother of one daughter, living in a rural village of the Dambae district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Cassava cultivation is the main source of her family’s income, and her husband supplements the income by cultivating rubber trees. Having engaged in this business for five years, Keat is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Keat’s group is comprised of three members, who are all female and live in the same village. Keat is a client in her first loan cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, each person. Keat will use her portion of the loan funds to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava. With this loan, she hopes to grow her cassava, as well as her rubber trees, healthfully, and she hopes to sell her products for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava

loans.name: Julio C. Tello Al Progreso Group

texts.es: Cordiales saludos este es el grupo “Julio C. Tello Al Progreso” conformado por 08 mujeres trabajadoras que gracias a sus negocios han logrado sacar adelante a sus familias. Este el caso de Damiana con 59 años de edad casada y 05 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica al tejido de prendas como chompas, chalinas y colchas, la cual es elaborada en hilo y lana, este negocio lo realiza a pedidos, pues cuenta  con clientes recurrentes. Damiana se siente feliz pues este negocio le ha permitido aportar con los gastos de su hogar. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su vivienda. Su último  crédito lo destinará para la compra de hilo y lana en mayor cantidad. Daminana es la tercera del lado derecho viste polo blanco, falda y una vincha en su cabello. En la parte superior está Florinda no puedo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.  El grupo  "Julio C. Tello al Progreso" agradecen el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Dear all

This is the “Julio C. Tello Al Progreso” group, composed of eight hardworking women that have been able to progress with their families thanks to their businesses.

This is the case of Damiana, who is 59, married and has five independent children. Damiana weaves garments such as sweaters, scarfs and quilts, in both threads and wool. She works upon request, since she has loyal customers. Damiana enjoys having this business, as it has helped her to contribute to the home’s expenses. Her biggest dream is to finish building her house. She will use the loan to buy threads and wool in larger quantities.

Damiana is located to the right of the picture. She is wearing a white shirt, a skirt and a hairband. Florinda, the lady in the added picture, could not make it in time for the meeting because of her job. The group appreciates the granted loan.

loans.use: to buy threads and wool.

loans.name: Vat

texts.en:
Vat is aged 46 years old and married. He lives with his wife and five children in a rural area located in the Dambae district, Cambodia. He is a rice farmer of two hectares of farmland. Besides this, he also plants cassava and rubber trees to earn additional income for his family. 

Vat has been in this business for 11 years. The current business earns his family about US $20 per day to feed the family, but he manages to save about US $7 each day.

This is the first loan for Vat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now he is requesting a loan. He is going to use this loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for his farmland. 

Vat hopes to increase his crop yield, so as to sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for his farmland.

loans.name: Pot

texts.en:
Pot is a 28-year-old father of three children living in a rural village of the Dambae district, Cambodia. To make a living, he and his wife have been growing cassava and beans on a four hectare of farmland for almost eight years. The current business earns him about 37,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second microloan for Pot with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He fully repaid the previous loan. 

Now he is asking for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. With this loan, he is going to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his income to enhance his living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland.

loans.name: Avei

texts.en:
Avei is a 44-year-old married woman with seven children. She makes and sells pancakes and pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Avei needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, baking powder and oil. She plans to use her profits to support her family and kids. Avei has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, and oil.

loans.name: Kimhan's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Prey Chhor district, where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Kimhan is a 60-year-old mother of six children, three of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. Rice farming is the main source of her family’s income which she and her husband have been in for 35 years. 

This is the fourth micro-loan for Kimhan with Kiva’s partner and she completely paid back the past three loans. Kimhan has successfully used the loans to buy household supplies for her family’s consumption. 

Now leading her group of four to apply for a loan, Kimhan will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Blanca Aurora

texts.es:
La Señora Blanca de 43 años vive con su hija, en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 25  años a la venta de arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, aceite, papel higiénico, pollo, carne, embutidos, pastas de tomate, espaguetis, refrescos en todas sus presentaciones.
Doña Blanca vende de lunes a domingo y sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y amigos de su comunidad, su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación.
Doña Blanca está solicitando  el préstamo para compra de  más productos alimenticios como ser refrescos, jugos, malteadas, pollo, arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, salsas, embutidos, huevos, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo espera que sus ventas incrementen y que mejore un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Blanca su sueño es tener siempre su negocio y sacar adelanté a su hija en los estudios. 


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero 2013
texts.en:
Blanca, 43, lives with her daughter in her house located in a community in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.  For 25 years she has made a living selling rice, beans, shortening, eggs, oil, toilet paper, chicken, meat, cold cuts, tomato paste, spaghetti, and all types of soda.

Blanca sells from Monday through Sunday, and all her neighbors and friends in the community are her customers.  Her business is located in her house.

Blanca's requesting a loan to buy more food products such as soda, juice, malts, chicken, rice, sugar, shortening, beans, salsas, cold cuts, eggs, etc.  With the support of this loan she hopes to increase her sales and improve the quality of life of herself and her family.

Blanca's dream is to always have her business and to get her daughter ahead in her studies.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, January 2013

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Yacine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 07 femmes a été crée depuis le 28/05/2009 il regroupe des femmes du même quartier unies par de bons liens sociaux et professionnels.
Le responsable madame Yacine est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo la main levée  et habillée en robe fleurette jaune. Elle est âgée de 23 ans mariée et mère d'une fille. Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus depuis son adhésion dans le banc villageois.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 500.000 francs cfa elle va se payer des paquets de tissus divers composés de wax Khartoum et basin teintés. Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires de sa petite famille mais également de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en: This group of 7 women was created on the 28th of May, 2009 and groups together women who live in the same district and are united by strong social and professional bonds. The group's leader, Yacine, is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised and wearing a dress with a yellow floweret pattern. She is 23 years old, married and is a mother, with one daughter. She has been selling fabrics since joining the "banc villageois". With her new loan of 500 000 francs, she will buy packages of various fabrics containing wax Khartoum and dyed damask. The profits generated by her business allow her to take care of the food needs of her small family and also to build her savings with the "banc villageois".

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Dos De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “DOS DE MAYO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Luzgarda tiene 50 años de edad ,03 hijos y es casada, la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como colonias, perfumes, cremas entre otros, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus amistades y familiares, que le solicitan, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como perfumes y colonias.

Los otros socios se dedican a la venta de ropa, crianza de animales menores, venta de granos secos, tienda de abarrotes, taxistas, abogado y trabajador público.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde  a la reunión por  motivos de trabajo.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Dos de mayo" ["Second of May"]. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the Cusco province and the Cusco region.

The member, Luzgarda, is 50 years old and married, and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling beauty products like colognes, perfumes, and creams, among other products. She travels to different neighbourhoods to sell to friends and relatives, who place orders with her. She has been in this business for years, and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts in everyday. She is a responsible and hardworking person, and it is in this way that she supports her family.

She is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise like perfumes and colognes.

The other members work selling clothes, raising small animals, selling dried grains, in grocery stores, as taxi drivers, as a lawyer and as a public service worker.

The members that appear in the accompanying photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work commitments.

Luzgarda feels grateful for the loan and is committed to meeting the set payment deadlines.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like perfumes and colognes.

loans.name: G.s Monte De Sion Group

texts.es:
La señora  Digna de 60 años de edad, vive con su esposo en su  casa de habitación, ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras, se dedica a la actividad de  venta de camisas, pantalones, faldas, chores, vestidos, ropa de niño, ropa interior de juvenil, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal y sus clientes son todas las personas que transitan por la calle donde tiene su negocio. 
Doña Digna está solicitando el préstamo para comprar de uniformes, calcetas, camisetas, pantalones, cuballeras, zapatos de escuela, faldas, etc. porque sus ventas en esta temporada escolar mejoran, su sueño es poder mejorar su casa de habitación.
Doña Digna al igual que sus compañeras de grupo con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende seguir invirtiéndolo en sus negocios y seguir creciendo para poder mejorar un poco sus calidades de vida y las de sus familias. 
Don Marco tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva. 
Doña Norma se dedica a la venta de Achinería.
Don José se dedica a la venta de verduras.
Don José Luis se dedica a la venta de abarrotería.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2013
texts.en:
Digna, 60, lives with her husband in their home, located in the community of San Lorenzo, south of Honduras. She sells shirts, pants, skirts, shorts, dresses, children's clothing, underwear. 
Her business is located in the municipal market and her customers are all the people who walk through that area. 
Digna is requesting the loan to buy uniforms, socks, shirts, pants, cuballeras (type of shirt), school shoes, skirts, etc., because her sales improve during the school semester. 
Her dream is to make improvements to her home. 
Digna and the members of her group can continue investing in and growing their businesses in order to improve their families' qualities of life, as well as their own.
Marco sells new clothes. Norma sells baubles and trinkets. Jose sells vegetables. Jose Luis sells grocery items.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - January 2013

loans.use: buy uniforms, socks, shirts, pants,  cuballeras (type of shirt), school shoes, skirts, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Gladis Eunice

texts.es:
La  Señora  Gladis es  una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  pulpería. 
Doña Gladis el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, arroz, manteca, café, azúcar, frijoles, arroz, huevos, salsas, pastas pan, etc.  Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercadería  que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos.
Doña Gladis espera mejorar un poco su situación  económicos y de su  familia, en unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la pulpería más grande y  reconocido de la zona y  seguir  apoyando a su familia  para  que  sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honesta  y bien.




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Enero  del   2013
texts.en:
Gladis is a responsible, honest and hard-working person who lives with her husband and three children in southern Hunduras.
She runs a grocery store. Gladis is requesting a loan to invest in corn, firewood, lime, rice, butter, coffee, sugar, beans, eggs, salsa, pasta, bread, etc. With the loan she hopes her sales will increase as she'll have more merchandise to offer her customers and will be able to cover their needs. 
Gladis hopes to improve hers and her family's economic situation. 
She hopes her business keeps growing and consolidating so that in a few years it will become the biggest and most well known grocery store in the area and she also hopes she can continue supporting her family to help her children finish school and become good, honest people.

Choluteca, Honduras – January 2013

loans.use: buy corn, firewood, lime, rice, butter, coffee, sugar, beans, eggs, salsa, pasta, bread, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Kmao's Group

texts.en:
Kmao is 46 years old and married. She lives in a rural village of Me Mot district, Kampong Cham province. She has five children, and two of them are staying with the family and still in school. She has been farming rice and cassava for 16 years, to support her family. To supplement the family's income, she also sells groceries. She currently can earn about 80,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Kmao is in her third loan cycle. Her previous two loans helped her to better support her family. Now, she is leading her group of two people, to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Kmao, the group leader, is going to use her portion of the loan funds to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income and to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in her rice and cassava cultivation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Me Mot district

loans.name: Guéda

texts.fr: Madame Guéda, âgée de 43 ans est mariée et mère de famille. Elle possède 5 enfants dont l’ainé a 17 ans et le plus jeune, 5 ans. Guéda fait du commerce depuis 4 ans. Elle a décidé d’acheter un réfrigérateur  pour améliorer son activité en vendant de la glace et des crèmes, d'autant plus que c'est une zone ou il fait très chaud d'ou c'est une activité qui peu marcher. Elle n’a pas de charges qui l’encombrent sinon ses propres besoins personnels. Elle espère si elle a les moyens de pouvoir acquérir une boutique de produits divers dans l’avenir.
texts.en: Guéda is 43 years old, married and a mother. She has 5 children, the eldest of whom is 17 years old and the youngest, 5. Guéda has been a retailer for 4 years. She has decided to buy a fridge so that she can improve her business by selling ice cream. Since the area is very hot, this activity can work well. The only expenses she has to cover are for her own personal needs. One day, if she has enough funds, she would like to buy a shop and sell various products.

loans.use: to buy a fridge to sell ice cream

loans.name: Dennis

texts.es:
El Señor Dennis de  35  años de edad, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 06  años al negocio de venta de leña y granos basicos, tiene terrenos en donde el paga a mozos para que le vayan a sacar la leña y despues el la vende.
Don Dennis sale todos dias a vender sus productos a barrios y colonias de la comunidad donde vive, es una persona muy responsable y honesta.
Don Dennis está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz y también para pagar a mozos que le vayan a cortar la leña para almacenarla y así solo estar cargando el carro para ir a vender.
Don Denis su sueño es montar una pulpería en su casa de habitación.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2013
texts.en:
Dennis, 35, lives in his own house in the community of San Lorenzo, south of Honduras. He has been selling firewood and basic grains for 6 years. He hires workers to go to his land, remove firewood and then he sells it. 
Dennis goes out to sell every day in the neighborhoods and colonies around the community he lives in. 
He's an honest and responsible person.
Dennis is requesting a loan to buy corn, beans, rice and to pay the workers who cut the firewood and then he loads up the car to go and sell. 
Dennis' dream is to start a grocery store in his house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -- January 2013

loans.use: buy corn, beans and rice for his business.

loans.name: Sol Y Luna Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL Y LUNA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es  el señor  Mario, el socio tiene 55 años de edad,03 hijos y es conviviente; él socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 07:00am hasta las 07:00pm aproximadamente, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su carro como en el cambio de aceite.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesania, imprenta, fotocopiadoras, venta de bisutería, mestro constructor, cocinero, trabajadores del sector público.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Sol y Luna” communal bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district, part of the Cusco province and department.

The member in question is Mario: he is 55 years old with 3 children and is a husband. Mario alternates his daily activities offering taxi services. He has spent many years in this business which is going well thanks to the hard work he puts in every day. Mario works from Monday to Friday from approximately 7:00 am to 7:00 pm. He is a responsible and diligent person given that this is the way in which he gets his family ahead in life. Mario is seeking this loan to maintain his car such as changing the oil.

The other members make their living selling handicrafts, printing, photocopiers, selling jewelry, skilled builder, cook and public sector workers. Mario is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this method. He promises to meet the repayments within the set time frame.

loans.use: to maintain his car such as changing the oil.

loans.name: Nhorn's Group

texts.en:
Nhorn is 49 years old, living with her husband and seven children in a rural village of the Dambae district. Four of her children are still dependent on her and still in school. Rice farming and cassava planting have been the main sources of her family’s income for several years. The current business earns her family a daily income of about 40,000 KHR but she is able to save 20,000 KHR each day. 

This is the third loan for Nhorn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she completely paid back the past loans. She is now leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, Nhorn will use her portion to spend on buying pesticides for her plantation and she will use a portion to plow the field. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her plantation.

loans.name: Sinoern's Group

texts.en:
Sinoern, aged 53, living in a rural village of the Dambae district, has three children. She and her husband have been planting cassava on 1.2-hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for twenty-eight years. Together, they can earn about 16,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sinoern has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loan while the other members have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her cassava planting so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Eddi Elena

texts.es:
Eddi de 44 años de edad, una humilde señora, originaria de Comunidad el Jicaral, en las afueras de León,  casada, madre de 4 hijos entre las edades de 11, 15, 18 y 20 años respectivamente, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio hace 22 años, ya que miro que en donde ella vivía no había Pulperías cercas y fue allí que se le vino a la idea de emprender su propio negocio, la cual miro que le iba a generar mejores ingresos, debido a que no habían negocio para que le hicieran competencia, este ha sido su primer negocio,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, sus productos lo comercializa en su casa de habitación, cuenta con otros ingresos como es el dinero que le da su esposo. Hoy en día Eddi  quiere invertir en su pulpería para poder ofrecer a sus clientes productos variados y obtener mejores ganancias. 
Se acerca la temporada escolar y es por esta razón que Eddi esta solicitando el financiamiento  para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, reglas, borradores, lápices de colores etc. Todos los insumos necesario que aun no tiene en existencia, ella estima que este crédito le será de ayuda porque podrá surtir su negocio para mayor atracción de su clientela, de esta manera incrementaran sus ventas generando a la vez mejores ingresos, una de sus metas próximas es poder cancelar este crédito, para luego volver a solicitar otro.
texts.en:
Eddi, 40 years old, is a modest woman, a native of the Jicaral community on the outskirts of León. She is married and the mother of four children, who are 11, 15, 18 and 20 years of age respectively. She is a merchant, the owner of a small store. She started in commerce 22 years ago, because she saw that there were no stores near where she was living. Thus she got the idea to open her own business, which she saw was going to generate a better income since there was no competition. This has been her first business and she relies on the support of her husband. She sells her products from her home and depends on other income, such as the money that her husband gives her. 

Nowadays Eddi wants to invest in her store in order to be able to offer her customers a more varied inventory and obtain more income. The new school season is approaching and this is the reason that Eddi is requesting the funding to purchase school supplies, such as notebooks, pencils, rulers, erasers, colored pencils, etc. These are all necessary supplies that she still does not have. She estimates that this loan will be a help because she will be able to stock her business to attract more customers. In this way she will increase her sales and generate more earnings. One of her next goals is to pay off this loan so that she will then be able to return to request another one.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pencils, rulers, erasers, colored pencils, etc.

loans.name: Qori Chaska De Qollana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORI CHASKA DE QOLLANA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de San Jeronimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es  el señor  José Luis, el socio tiene 29 años de edad,02 hijos y es casada; él socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 07:00am hasta las 07:00pm aproximadamente, , el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de algunos repuestos para su carro.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, crianza de animales menores, venta de comida, restaurante, taxista, restaurante.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Qori Chaska De Qollana."  This bank is located in the San Jeronimo district in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is José Luis.  He is 29 years old, has 2 children, and is married.  He alternates his daily activities offering service as a taxi.  He has been in this business for years and it works well for him, thanks to the effort that he puts in every day to his business.  He works Monday through Friday from about 7:00 am to 7:00 pm.  He is responsible and determined and it is in this way that he helps his family get ahead.

José is asking for a loan in order to buy some spare parts for his taxi.  The other members of the group work in businesses such as owning a grocery stores, raising small animals, selling food, a restaurant, taxi-driving, and a restaurant.  José thanks those that are a part of this dream in this way and he promises to make his payments when they are due.

loans.use: buy a few parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña” se reúne cada treinta dias en la ciudad del Cusco. (Cusco es lugar conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”) 

El socio Armando nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, tiene 28 años de edad y todavía es soltero. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de taxi. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro.  Se encuentra contento por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The "Amistad Cusqueña" communal bank meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco.  (Cusco is well-known for being a very touristic and commercial area.  It is also known for its "Inti Raymi" traditional festival and because you find one of the seven wonders of the world there - Machu Picchu).

Member Armando was born in the city of Quillabamba but he lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  He is 28 years old and still single.  He earns a living as a taxi driver.  On this occasion he needs a loan to maintain his car.  He is happy with the loan and promises to make his repayments on time.  He is thankful for the help provided to him.

loans.use: to maintain his car.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco. (Cusco es lugar conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”) 

El socio José  nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 39 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la elaboración de muebles de madera como sillas, carpetas, roperos, camas, mesas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera, cola de carpintero y otras cosas más. Se encuentra contento por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The Amistad Cusqueña communal bank meets every month in the city of Cusco.  (Cusco is a place known for being a very commercial area with a lot of tourists, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World is there, Machu Picchu.)

The member, José, was born in the city of Cusco.  He's 39 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which he has three children.  His main economic activity is making wood furniture such as chairs, wardrobes, beds, tables, and other pieces.

He needs this loan to buy working materials such as wood, carpenter's glue, and other things.

He's happy about the loan and pledges to make his payments punctually.  He's grateful for the help offered.

loans.use: to buy wood, carpenter's glue, and other work materials

loans.name: San Hilario Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN HILARIO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es  el señor  Julio Cesar, el socio tiene 37 años de edad, 01 hijo  y es separado; él socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi dentro de la ciudad, el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio trabaja todos los días durante el día, el socio se siente bien con su trabajo ya que mediante este el puede apoyar económicamente a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su carro como en el cambio de aceite.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de productos lacteos, venta de ropa, farmacia, trabajadores independientes, electrisista.
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the San Hilario communal bank in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco.

The member, Julio César, is 37 years old.  He has one child and is separated.  He alternates his daily activities with offering taxi service in the city.  He has been in this business for years and it's going well for him thanks to the effort he puts into it every day.  He works every day during the day.  He feels good about his job because with it he's able to help his family economically.

He's requesting the loan to do maintenance on his car, such as an oil change.

The other members make a living selling dairy products, selling clothing, in a pharmacy, working independently, and as an electrician.

He's grateful to those who are part of his dream through this loan and he pledges to make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to do car maintenance

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco. (Cusco es lugar conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”) 

El socio Julio Cesar nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 21 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de taxi. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. Se encuentra contento por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The Amistad Cusqueña communal bank meets every month in the city of Cusco.  (Cusco is known for being a very commercial area with a lot of tourists, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World is there, Machu Picchu.)

The member, Julio César, was born in the city of Cusco.  He's 21 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which he has one child.  His main economic activity is offering taxi service.

He's requesting this loan to do maintenance on his car.

He's happy about the loan and pledges to make his payments punctually.  He's grateful for the help offered.

loans.use: to do car maintenance

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco. (Cusco es lugar conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”) 

El socio Javier nació en la ciudad de Paruro pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, tiene 30 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de taxi. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. Se encuentra contento por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The “Amistad Cusqueña” Community Bank meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco. (Cusco is known for its tourists, commerce, traditional "Inti Raymi" festival, and for its proximity to one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu).

The bank member Javier was born in the city of Paruro, but now lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. He is 30 years old and has a partner. with whom he has a child. His main job is as a taxi driver. At the moment, he requires a loan to carry out car maintenance. He is happy about the loan and promises to make his repayments on time. He is grateful for the help provided.

loans.use: to maintain his car.

loans.name: Claudia Melissa

texts.es: La  señora Claudia tiene 29 años de edad, soltera, no tiene hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, pero vive con su hermano el cual también trabaja,  vive en la provincia cercado de Cochabamba en la zona oeste, perseverante con sus metas, a pesar de que ella estudio sola, sin sus padres a su lado, esto debido a que sus papas viven en la cuidad de Potosí y son de pocos recursos, ella sola salió  adelante y egreso de la carrera de Administración de Empresas de la Universidad pública  Mayor de San Simón con  su propio  sacrificio, ahora ella trabaja en una cooperativa de Cochabamba  ejerciendo su profesión, además se  dedica a la venta de mercadería (ropa) a los vecinos de la zona en la que vive, el motivo del presente crédito  es para poder comprar más mercadería (ropa) y seguir con dicha actividad sin dejar de lado su  profesión.
texts.en:
Claudia is 29 years old, single and has no children. She lives with her brother, who is employed, in the province close to Cochabamba in the west region. 

She works hard to achieve her goals and got an education by herself, without her parents to support her. They live in Potosí and lack financial resouces.

She got ahead and graduated with a degree in Business Administration from the public Universidad Mayor de San Simón through her own sacrifice. 

Claudia now works in a company in Cochabamba, but she also sells clothes to her neighbours. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise (clothes) and continue with this activity without having to leave her profession.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Victor Rafael

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco. (Cusco es lugar conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”) 

El socio Victor nació en la ciudad de Anta pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, tiene 25 años de edad y es soltero. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de taxi. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. Se encuentra contento por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The Community Bank “Amistad Cusqueña” meets on the thirtieth of each month in the city of Cusco. (Cusco is known for being a tourist and commercial city because of its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because "Macchu Picchu," one of the seven wonders of the world, is located here.)  

Victor was born in the city of Anta but lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. He is 25 years old and single. His primary economic activity is providing a taxi service. At this time, Victor is requesting the loan in order to do maintenance on his car. He is very happy for the loan and is committed to paying his installments on time. He is very thankful for the help.

loans.use: do maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco. (Cusco es lugar conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”) 

El socio Lucio nació en la ciudad de Abancay pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, tiene 39 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de taxi y también tiene un pequeño restaurante quien administra el negocio es su esposa. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo verduras, arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más. Se encuentra contento por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The Community Bank “Amistad Cusqueña” meets on the thirtieth of each month in the city of Cusco. (Cusco is known for being a tourist and commercial city because of its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because "Macchu Picchu," one of the seven wonders of the world, is located here.)

Lucio was born in the city of Abancay but lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. He is 39 years old, married, and has two children from his beautiful relationship. His primary economic activity is providing a taxi service, but he also owns a small restaurant, which his wife manages. 

At this time, Lucio is requesting the loan in order to buy supplies for his restaurant, such as vegetables, rice, sugar, and others. He is very happy for the loan and is committed to paying his installments on time. He is thankful for the help offered.

loans.use: buy supplies, such as vegetables, rice, sugar, and others.

loans.name: Ayelen

texts.es: La joven Ayelen, es soltera, universitaria, teniendo como dependientes a una de sus hermanas que están a su cargo la cual ya está por salir bachiller, la actividad que realiza es de servicios teniendo un Café Internet  con 14 máquinas y el servicio de fotocopiadoras teniendo dos, estando la misma ubicada entre dos avenidas principales de la ciudad, a la cual le ayudan sus hermanas teniendo a una como personal fijo y la otra ocasionalmente como su madre y su hermano.  La actividad es regular durante todo el año especialmente se incrementa en temporada escolar. Ayelen es universitaria teniendo una experiencia de cinco años en su rubro llevando un registro regular de sus ingresos y egresos para su negocio, conoce bastante el mercado en el que vende. Se provee generalmente de mayoristas que le dejan en su negocio como ser hojas, tonners ,y todo lo demás teniendo un grado de satisfacción bueno en la provisión de sus insumos. Su mercado es de las empresas circundantes que están en su cuadra y de las que están en su edificio, asi como de las personas que circulan por la calle teniendo varios colegios circundantes, la competencia que tiene es normal por estar situada en el centro de la ciudad, teniendo una estabilidad en sus precios durante todo el año.
texts.en:
This young woman, Ayelen, is single and is a university student.  One of her sisters is her dependent, since she is in charge of her; her sister is about to complete her last year of high school.  

Ayelen's economic activity is having an internet cafe.  She has fourteen computers, and also a photocopying service; she has two photocopy machines.  Her cafe is located between two main streets in the city.  Her sisters help her; one of them is a permanent staff member, and the other helps out sometimes, as do her mother and brother.  She carries out this service during the entire year, and business increases during the school year.  

Ayelen is a university student who has five years experience in her field, keeping a regular record of her incomes and expenses for her business.  She knows a lot about the market in which she sells.  

She generally supplies her store through wholesalers, who drop the items off to her store, like sheets of paper and toners.  She has a good degree of satisfaction with this provision of supplies.  

Her market includes the surrounding companies on her block, those that are located within the same building, and also the people that are walking on the street; there are several high schools close by.  

The competition she has is normal for being situated in the center of the city.  She keeps her prices stable throughout the entire year.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Henry Santiago

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco. (Cusco es lugar conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”) 

El socio Henry nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, tiene 26 años de edad y es soltero. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de taxi. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. Se encuentra contento por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The communal Bank "Amistad Cusqueña" meets each month on the 30th in the city of Cusco. Cusco is a well known for being a commercial zone and popular tourist area, for its traditional festival of Inti Raym, and because one of the seven wonders of the world is here, "Machupicchu".

The member Henry was born in the city of Quillabamba but lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. He is 26 years old and is single. His main economic activity is to provide taxi service. In this opportunity he needs a loan to do maintenance on his vehicle. He is very happy with the loan and promises that his payment will be punctual. He is grateful for the assistance provided.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco. (Cusco es lugar conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”) 

La socia María nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 41 años de edad y es padre y madre para sus dos hijos. Su actividad económica principal es vender ropa interior como calcetines, sostenes, calzoncillos, calzones y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como calcetines. Se encuentra contenta por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The Community Bank “Amistad Cusqueña” meets on the thirtieth of each month in the city of Cusco. (Cusco is known for being a tourist and commercial city because of its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because "Macchu Picchu," one of the seven wonders of the world, is located here.)

Maria was born in the city of Cusco. She is 41 years old and is both father and mother to her two children. Her primary economic activity is selling interior clothing, such as socks, bras, boxers, underwear, and others. At this time, she is requesting the loan in order to buy merchandise, such as socks. She is very happy for the loan and is committed to paying her installments on time. She is very thankful for the help offered.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as socks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco. (Cusco es lugar conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”) 

La socia Elizabeth nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 30 años de edad y es padre y madre para sus dos hijos. Su actividad económica principal es vender ropa  pero también se dedica bridar servicio de llamadas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como polos. Se encuentra contenta por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The Amistad Cusqueña communal bank meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco.  (Cusco is a place that is known for being a tourist and commercial area.  It is known for its traditional Inti Raymi celebration and for Machupicchu, one of the Seven Wonders of the World.)

Elizabeth was born in the city of Cusco.  She is 30 years old, and she is mother and father to her two children.  Her main business activity is selling clothes.  However, she also provides calling services.

She now needs the loan to buy merchandise like polo style shirts.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments punctually.  She is grateful for the help that has been provided.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like polo style shirts.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco. (Cusco es lugar conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”) 

El socio Marco Antonio nació en la ciudad de Lima pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, tiene 36 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de taxi pero también se vende cerveza y gaseosas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como gaseosas. Se encuentra contento por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The Amistad Cusqueña communal bank meets every month in the city of Cusco.  (Cusco is known for being a very commercial area with a lot of tourists, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World is there, Machu Picchu.)

The member, Marco Antonio, was born in the city of Lima but lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  He's 36 years old and in a common-law relationship from which he has three children.  His main economic activity is offering taxi service but he also sells beer and soda.

He needs this loan to buy merchandise such as soda.

He's happy about the loan and pledges to make his payments punctually.  He's grateful for the help offered.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as soda

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco. (Cusco es lugar conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”) 

El socio Leoncio nació en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, tiene 52 años de edad y es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal es vender libros y brindar servicio de taxi. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como libros. Se encuentra contento por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Communal bank "Amistad Cusqueña" gathers every 30th day of the month in the city of Cusco. Cusco is a very popular touristic and commercial destination, famous for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it has one of the world’s seven wonders, Machu Picchu.

Leoncio, one of the bank’s members, was born in the beautiful city of Cusco. He is 52 years old, married and has four children. Leoncio sells books and drives a taxi. This time, he is requesting a loan to buy books. He appreciates receiving the loan and promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy books to sell.

loans.name: Eath

texts.en:
Eath is a 36-year-old citizen from the Sa Ang district of Kandal Province, Cambodia.  She makes a living farming rice and working at a factory.  She has 13 years’ experience in the current business, earning about $5 per day and saving $1 per day.

Her income is mainly to support the necessary daily expenses, mostly for her two little sons.  Eath will use her first loan with VisionFund to buy potash and rice seeds for her farm.  She hopes that her living conditions will improve gradually from her business income.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seed.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla is 27 years old. She is married and resides with a son in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been making piggy banks to sell and fattening up animals for more than four years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture with her son) runs the business of purchasing junk material to resell. He earns about $10 daily. Due to lack of funds, Phalla requests a loan of $1500 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Thmor Kol district of Battambang Province, Vuthy is married and has five children. Three of his children still rely on him, as they are still in school. 

Vuthy feeds his family through rice cultivation and fish paste selling. In his 16-year engagement in this business, he has been able to earn up to 32,200 KHR per day from the current business. 

Vuthy currently is in the fifth loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. His past loan has been repaid with success, and it has helped him to strengthen his business gradually. 

This cycle, Vuthy and one of the villagers formed a group of two and are seeking the same loan amount of 800,000 KHR each. As a group leader, Vuthy is going to spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for his farm. He hopes to grow his rice seasonably so that he can upgrade his living condition in a good manner.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for his farm.

loans.name: Inn

texts.en:
An elderly woman from Kampong Cham Province (Cambodia), Inn is the mother of seven children. To support her daily cost of living, she grows rice on two hectares of farmland, whereas her husband is a house builder in the local area. The current business earns her about 30,500 KHR per day, and she saves about 5,000 KHR per day after offsetting other expenses. 

She is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  Since the previous loans have been repaid, she feels empowered that she can upgrade her lifestyle gradually. 

Now, she is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pay for a transplanting fee. 

She hopes to grow her cash-crop in a timely manner, and get a good yield so that she can earn more income to buy an additional plot of farmland for growing more rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for the transplanting fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao is 54 years old.  She is widowed and resides with seven children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.  She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than two years, earning approximately $7 per day.  Her daughter runs an electrical shop, earning about $3 a day.  Three other children are employed in the factory, earning about $7 each day.  

In order to improve her family’s finances, Pao is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase more electrical goods to sell.  This money will help her increase her stock and generate more income for the family.  In the future, she would like to run a phone repair shop for her son and build a new, bigger house to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical goods to sell.

loans.name: Suong's Group

texts.en:
Suong is 51 years old and a widowed mother who struggles to make a living in order to support her four schoolchildren through one hectare of cassava cropping. She has been involved in this business for 31 years and is able to earn up to KHR 17,000 per day. From this income, she is able to save up to KHR 8,000 per day, after deducting the necessary expenses.  

In the second-cycle group consisting of two females (Suong's Group), Suong is the group leader. She has intelligently utilized her past loans to support her business on time, especially in purchasing insecticide for her farmland. However, shortage of manpower to support her business remains the key challenge for her. 

Therefore, she is applying for a new loan from VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) in order to pay for labor to plow her farmland. She hopes to grow her crops in a timely manner and receive double-yield, with a high selling price.

loans.use: to pay for labor to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
A 26-year-old mother of a little boy residing in Kampong Cham Province’s Ponhea Krek district, Yat is a farmer who manages one hectare of land for growing paddy rice and a half hectare for planting watermelon. To supplement the family’s income, her husband works for someone else. Yat's current daily income is 19,600 KHR, 12,500 KHR of which is her daily saving after deducting expenses.

Yat's previous loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), since repaid, has uplifted her standard of living progressively. Now, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan, each requesting 500,000 KHR. As group leader, Yat will use her loan portion along with her savings to buy a mini-tractor to support her farmland. She hopes to make more profit from her business so she can further improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a mini-tractor to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Peou

texts.en:
Peou is 38 years old.  She is widowed and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.  She has been cultivating vegetables to sell for more than seven years, earning approximately $2 per day.  Her child is employed in a garment factory and earns about $4 a day.  

Due to the lack of funds, Peou is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase timber to fix her house.  This money will help her provide a better living condition for the family.  In the future, she would like to expand her business in order to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase timber to fix her house.

loans.name: Saly

texts.en:
Saly is 51 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in cultivating rice and selling mixed snacks for more than four years, earning approximately USD 5 daily. Three of her children are employed. They earn about USD 15 each day. 

Due to lack of funds, Saly requests a loan of USD 1,100 to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and toilet. This money will help her provide hygienic living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her youngest child earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and toilet.

loans.name: Thary

texts.en: Thary is 50 years old. She is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a journalist who makes an income of $5 per day. Two of her children are garment workers. They earn about $8 each day. Due to lack of funds, Thary is requesting a loan of $600 to pay for her child’s school fees. This money will help her child pursue a bachelor’s degree. In the future, she would like to expand the business and build a new house.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school fee

loans.name: Kimhoeurn

texts.en: Residing in Kandal province of Cambodia, Kimhoeurn is a widowed mother of one schoolgirl. To sustain her family, she grows paddy rice and mango on a half hectare of farmland each. The 35 years’ experience in this business generates about USD 9 per month. Now, Kimhoeurn is in her fourth loan cycle. The past loans that she has fully repaid back have enabled her to support both cash crops timely and relieved her family’s burden progressively. With this newly requested loan, she will use her loan portion as a group leader to buy mango seedlings and to buy fertilizer for her rice cropping. She hopes to gain more yield and sell at a good price so that she can cover her children’s education until the university level.

loans.use: To buy mango seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 34 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in running a poultry farm for more than 2 years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a goldsmith who makes an income of $3 each day. Two of her children are also in the goldsmith business. They earn about $6 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Mom requested a loan of $1000 to purchase gold and silver to produce more jewelry to sell. By doing so, her husband would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase gold and silver to produce more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
45 and the mother of four children, Phy is from the Sangke district of Battambang province. She grows rice as her primary source of income, and raises cows as supplemental income. She has engaged in this business for 22 years, and earns about 30,000 KHR per day. 

For her, the main challenge is the shortage of working capital to support her farmland. To overcome this challenge, she has formed a group of three to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan has allowed her to relieve her family’s burden, and improve her livelihood. 

With this loan, she is seeking 1,200,000 KHR, whereas her fellow group members are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As a the group leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for re-planting season. 

She hopes to increase her crop yield,  and make more profit for family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Kayseang

texts.en:
Kayseang, 40, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Kror Kor district, Pursat province, Cambodia. She has seven children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. For the past several years, Kayseang and her husband have been farming rice on a four-hectare plot of farmland, as the main source of the family’s income to make a living. Sometimes, her husband makes palm juice to earn extra income. Together, they can earn about 18,000 KHR per day from the current business. 

Kayseang has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles, and she completely paid back the past loans. They enabled her to better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will help her family to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To renovate her old house

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chan is a 56-year-old mother of seven children, who lives in Pursat Province. Currently, only two of her children still count on her, as they are in school. With two hectares of rice cultivation, she is able to earn up to 21,500 KHR per day. She has been with this business for 33 years.

Including this loan cycle, she is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). The most recent previous loan, which she fully repaid, provided her with sufficient working capital to sustain her business in a good pace. For this cycle, she is seeking the amount of 1,500,000 KHR in order to fix her house. She will use this amount to purchase necessary materials and to pay wages for labor. She hopes to own a decent house for her kids, so that she can focus on generating more income.

loans.use: To fix her house

loans.name: Soeurn's Group

texts.en:
Soeurn is 59 years old and has been blessed with five children. She is a rural villager from Battambang province, who grows rice on four hectares of farmland in order to cover the daily cost of living for the entire family. This is the business that she has been with for 30 years.

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for seven past loan cycles. Her previous loan has been fully repaid. The loan capital better supported her business, and improved her living standard.

Now she is in a group of two, to apply for a new loan. She and her fellow group member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR, per person. Soeurn, the group leader, is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business and maintain her living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her rice farmland

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en: Living in Kror Kor district of Pursat Province where rice farming is one of the popular businesses in the area, Mai is 57 years old and blessed with five children. Not different from her neighborhood, she also does rice cropping on two hectares of farmland.  She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Mai has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three cycles including this cycle. After the successful loan which she has fully repaid, she feels very confident that she can improve her lifestyle gradually. Now, she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. She is requesting a loan amount of  1,400,000 KHR, whereas her fellow group member is asking for 600,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a mini tractor to support her farmland. She hopes this purchase will help her to minimize the expenses related to transportation fees. Therefore, she can use that money to support her living instead.

loans.use: to buy a mini tractor to support her farmland

loans.name: Phanny's Group

texts.en:
A 32-year-old mother of three little children and a rural villager from Pursat Province, Phanny is one of the breadwinners in the family. She struggles to deal with her family’s hardship through rice growing, while her husband works for others, for a fee, for extra income, besides helping on the farmland. Phanny has been working on this farmland for three years and is able to earn about KHR 13,200 per day. 

This is the fourth loan for Phanny with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). The past loans have returned her a positive impact on her living which has been upgraded to a good status. 

Now, she is in a group of two (Phanny's Group), to apply for a new loan. As group leader, Phanny will spend her loan portion to buy rice for resale, to earn extra income. She greatly hopes that she can maintain her living condition and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale.

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en: Sopheak is 28 years old and married. She is blessed with one daughter who currently is studying in a local school in the area. She makes a living through pig-raising while her husband is a barber. She has been engaged in this business for eight years. Sopheak has been with VisionFund for the past three cycles and has completely paid back the loan. She can support her income better than before and uplift her lifestyle. In a group of three female members, she is the leader. The total amount of her requesting group loan is 2,500,000 KHR. For Sopheak, she will use her loan portion to buy pig feed. She hopes to fatten her pig in a healthy condition so that she can sell it at a high price and get more income for her child's sake.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Vin's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Vin is 27 years old and married with two children, both of whom are dependents on her and still in school. To support her family, she has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland for several years, and her husband supplements the family’s income by making palm juice. From the current business, Vin can earn about 14,000 KHR per day and can save about 8,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Vin is in her first microloan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, Vin will use her portion to buy materials for renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper house for her family to live in.

loans.use: To buy materials to renovate her old house

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en: A 28-year-old mother of two schoolgirls and four rice farmers residing in Kampong Cham province, Khorn is married and earns a living from cassava and rice growing. The current business earns her almost $10 USD per day. Khorn is a sixth-cycle client with VisionFund this time, and it is the same cycle for her co-borrower in the group of two female members. Her past loan provided her sufficient working capital for her business, and she can afford to provide daily decent food for her family. For this new loan, she will use her loan portion as a group leader in order to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed, and to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes to grow her both cash-crops seasonably and get back more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed, and to pay for the plowing fee

loans.name: Rat

texts.en: Rat, a mother of two daughters, is a rural villager from Kampong Cham province. She is 26 years old and plants cassava as a single source of family income. For several years, she has been in this business, and she is able to earn up to 20,000 KHR per day and save up about 7,200 KHR. Rat has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three cycles and has fully repaid back her loan, which has relieved her family’s burden better than before. Now, she is reapplying for the fourth loan with VisionFund in amount of 2,000,000 KHR. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She hopes to boost her crop yield and minimize her loss due to pests so that she can gain more yield with more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Mei's Group

texts.en:
Mei is 47 years old and married. She is a trader residing in Pursat Province (Cambodia). For her family, the primary sources of income are from a small scale trading business including chicken and rice and from her husband's job as a construction worker. She has occupied this business for 6 years. 

This is the first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for her group consisting of two female members. Mei is seeking a loan of 800,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for a loan of 500,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy rice for stocking in order to resell for a higher price. She hopes that she can sell the rice for a higher price and receive a good income for her family’s sake.

loans.use: to buy rice for reselling.

loans.name: Sophoer

texts.en:
Sophoer is aged 23 years and married. She is a citizen from a rural village of Pursat province’s Bakan district. She has one daughter. She has worked hard as a rice farmer to better feed her family. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the fourth loan for Sophoer with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans. She has successfully used loans to better support her current business. Now she is asking for a new loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy a plot of land and use a portion of it to spend on running a new business as a grocery seller in a local area to earn extra income for her family.

Sophoer hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng is from Kampong Cham province, an area from which rubber plants are a famous product. A mother of four schoolchildren, Eng is 39 years old and manages a rubber plantation on three hectares of land. She just started this business three years ago. 

Eng's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) was a cycle ago. This loan has helped her to gradually unburden her family’s hardship, and she has managed to fully repay back her loan already. Now, she is applying for a new loan in order to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to get more income from her current business so that she can gradually improve her living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Chhum's Group

texts.en: A mother of five children who are still in school, Chhum is 35 years old and a is a rural resident from Kampong Cham province. Growing cassava and rice are her primary sources of income, earning her 23,600 KHR per day. Chhum has loaned from VisionFund four times, including this cycle, and has repaid back her loans completely. From the past loan, she earned a decent profit that reduced her family’s hardships and improved their livelihood. Now, she and her co-borrower are requesting 1,400,000 KHR each.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash, insecticide, and pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more income so that she can keep all of her children in school to complete a high level of education.

loans.use: To buy potash, insecticide, and pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
A grocery shop runner from Pusat Province, Morn is 47 years-old and a widowed mother of five children. In the village, she sells grocery items such as salt, canned food, instant noodles, etc. She has been engaged in this business for 24 years and she is able to earn up to 7,000 KHR per day. 

This is the third loan for Morn with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She has repaid back her earlier loans already and her living condition is better than before as she can provide more decent food for her children. Her new requested loan amount is 1,000,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy more grocery items to replenish her business for resell. She hopes to stock more items to sell on time so that she can absorb more clients and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Aged 34 years, Keo is a married mother of three children, living in the Thmor Koul district, Battambang province. All of her children are dependent on her and still in school. To better feed her family, Keo earns income as a rice farmer, while her husband is a paid laborer. Keo has been in the rice farming business for 10 years, and she can earn about 25,000 KHR per day. From her earnings, she can save about 13,000 KHR each day [52%].
 
This is the first loan for Keo with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR. She will use her loan to buy a plot of farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland, so as to increase her rice production, which will increase her family’s income. She hopes to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland, so she can grow more rice for income.

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Savorn is 33 and married with 2 children, both of whom are dependents and still attend school. For the last 13 years, she has been farming rice while her husband works as a taxi driver. Her current business earns her about KHR 27,000 per day of which she can save about KHR 14,000 daily for future needs. 

This is the second loan for Savorn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now requesting a loan of KHR 3,000,000, she is going to use it to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy grocery items to sell, earning additional income for her family. She hopes to earn more income so as to better off her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en: Aged 33 and residing in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Neng is a mother of a daughter who currently is studying at the local state school. The primary source of her income is crop husbandry, in particular rice and cassava growing. With 10 years of experience in this business, she is able to earn up to almost 24,000 KHR per day. Now, she is in need of working capital in order to timely support her cash-crops. Therefore, she formed a group of three to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).
