This is Neng's sixth time borrowing from VisionFund. Her past loans have been repaid back with success and have improved her standard of living in a gradual manner. This cycle, she and her fellow group members are requesting 2,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy potash and to pay for plowing fees for both cash-crops. She hopes to grow her paddy and generate more income so that she can build a bigger house for her family.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: A hardworking local farmer from Thbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Tha is an 53-year-old widow mother with six children. To feed the entire family, she struggles to support her family through rice farming, rubber tree planting, and casual labor. Her current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day. This is the third loan for Tha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She feels confident that she has improved her living standard due to her past loans which she fully paid back. Now, she is seeking a new loan for 2,100,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy a decent motorbike to support her business as well as for family use.  The motorbike will reduce the shipping expenses and transportation fees that she used to have to pay. Therefore, she can save that money to support her family instead.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike to support her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Naisim

texts.en:
Naisim, a 30-year-old citizen of Kampong Cham province, is a mother of one schoolboy. To tackle the daily cost of living, she farms rice crops and her husband makes concrete rings. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR.  

Naisim has just joined VisionFund this cycle. She is seeking 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy cement, sand, and gravel for supporting her husband's business. She hopes her husband can make more concrete rings so they can earn more profit to sustain their living.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, and gravel

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sengan's Group

texts.en: Sengan is a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has four children, two of whom are students. To support the necessary daily basic needs of her family, she grows rice and her husband works at another farm. She is able to earn up to 20,800 KHR per day from her current business that she has worked at for 13 years. Sengan is a third time borrower with VisionFund, and has repaid back her past loan already. The loan has improved her living standard. This cycle, she formed a group of four to apply for a new loan and she is the group leader. For Sengan, her loan portion will be used to buy potash for her farmland. She hopes her rice harvest will be bountiful and so that she will get back more profit to improve her standard of living even more.

loans.use: To buy potash for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en: Yan, a 49-year-old mother of seven children from Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia, is a local farmer who grows rice and cassava each on one hectare of farmland. The cash-crop has returned about 22,200 KHR per day to cover the basic need in her family. Currently, she is in need of working capital to support her crops, and so she formed a group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She used her past loan smartly to support her business, including paying a weeding fee and buying insecticide to maintain her yield. She also repaid her loan completely. This time, she and her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay a plowing fee to replant her cassava. She hopes to get more income from the business to continue upgrading her living in a good manner.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee to replant her cassava.

loans.name: Lang's Group

texts.en: Lang, 37, is married and has three children, two of which are school children while one is a paid-worker. She and her family live in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. For her, one hectare of cassava field is the only primary source of income to meet her family's daily food expenses. To supplement this income, her husband also works.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years and it enables her to earn up to 17,200 KHR per day. This is the fifth loan for Lang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful repayment of her past loans, she feels confident that she can continue to upgrade her standard of living progressively. Now, she is in a group of four in order to apply for a new loan. They are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to have good crops and make more income so that she can build a big house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
Savorn, 40, lives in a rural village in the Sampov Meas district of the Pursat Province. She is a married mother of four children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. Her family’s income is derived from leasing a two-hectare rice paddy and planting bean. She has been making a living from this business for 22 years. From her current business, she can earn about 37,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and save about 10,000 KHR per day for future needs.

Savorn’s group of four includes two members who live in the same village. This is her first group loan with VisionFund. As the leader of this group, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to produce more rice and bean to make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en: Nang is 44-years-old and is a resident from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. She is a local farmer who grows rice on two hectare of farmland. She has five children, two of whom are living with her and helping the family business and household chores. Her current business earns her about 10,300 KHR per day. This is Nang's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner.). She is the leader of a group composed of two female members. For her  loan portion she will buy potash and pesticides for her farmland. Also, she will use a portion of it to buy grocery items for resale as additional income. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy potash and pesticides for her farm and grocery items for resale

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Battambang province’s Sangke district, Phally is a 54-year-old father of five, two of whom are dependent on him and still in school. To support his children, Phally has been raising chickens and cows for 20 years while his wife has been working as a paid construction worker. Together, they can earn about KHR 34,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for the future needs.

Phally has been with VisionFund for seven cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. He completely paid back the past loans, which have helped him better support his family with enough food. Now he is leading a group of two to ask for a new loan. As the leader, Phally will use his portion to buy chicken feed and cows to raise. He hopes this loan will enable him to fatten his chickens and sell them for a high price to increase his family’s income to better his family’s living conditions and send his children to school.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and cows

loans.name: Limbert Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Limbert, es una persona que proviene del departamento de La Paz, a muy temprana edad emigro al departamento de Cochabamba para estudiar y trabajar. Ha concluido sus estudios para ser profesor, sin embargo no ha conseguido trabajo aun. Cuando Limbert estudiaba, se consiguió un trabajo como elaborador de salteñas, para que pueda solventar sus estudios así como su alimentación, vivienda y vestimenta. Ahora el es un experto en la elaboración de salteñas, por ello abrió su propio negocio con sus ahorros. Ahora es dueño de una pequeña salteñeria.
Limbert está muy agradecido de acceder a esta oportunidad y así poder mejorar su negocio, para hacerlo crecer y así consolidar su mercado, tener más clientela, más ventas y por tanto mayores ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida.
Entre sus planes futuros Limbert planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para comprar un vehículo y así poder transportar las deliciosas salteñas que elabora.
texts.en:
Limbert is is from the La Paz area, at a very young age he moved to Cochabamba to study and work.

He has finished studying to be a teacher, but he still has not managed to find work. When Limbert was studying, he managed to get a job making salteñas, with which he managed to fund his studies as well as his living costs. Now he is an expert in making salteñas and has been able to open his own business with his savings, he is the owner of his own shop.

Limbert is very grateful for this opportunity and will be able to improve his business, in order to grow his business and consolidate his market, have more customers, more sales and more income to improve his quality of life.

Among his plans for the future, Limbert plans to take out a new loan to buy a vehicle to deliver the delicious salteñas that he makes.

loans.use: to buy signs for his business.

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce Banc Villageois qui abrite le groupe est crée depuis le 24 octobre 2007. Ledit groupe est de 19 femmes qui habitent dans le même village et ceux des alentours. Une entente des femmes et une solidarité avérée fait leur fierté. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Nogoye âgée de 36 ans, est mariée et mère de 2 garçons et de 2 filles.
Elle fait comme activité le commerce de tissus, elle se rend dans les marchés de la ville pour s'approvisionner et revend  dans son village.
Les bénéfices générés lui permettront de prendre en charge les frais médicaux de ses enfants et leur scolarité. Pour améliorer la nourriture de la famille elle donne la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group belongs to a Banc Villageois created on October 24, 2007. It consists of 19 women who all live in the same cluster of villages. They are proud of their mutual understanding and proven solidarity. Their main activity is commerce.

Nogoye, age 36, is the member standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised. She is married with two sons and two daughters. She sells fabrics, buying her stock at local markets for resale in her own village. 

The profits earned will allow her to pay for her children’s healthcare and tuition. To help improve the family’s food situation, she also helps with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
Aged 55 years, Chin is widowed and lives in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. She is a mother of five children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. For the last twenty years, Chin has been farming rice and selling vegetables to make a living. She can earn about 60,000 KHR per day from her current business and can save about 10,000KHR each day for future needs. 


This is the first loan for Chin’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 KHR. Chin, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her harvest which will improve her living standard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Carlos Juan

texts.es: El señor: Carlos vive en el sindicato agrario Colorido-Ichilo pertenece al departamento de Santa Cruz frontera Cochabamba lo cual adquirió con mucho esfuerzo vive solo y trabaja dedicándose a la actividad agropecuaria. Tiene en producción cítricos (1/2ha), arroz (1/2ha) y tiene 15 cabezas de ganado vacuno lo cual vende en la feria. El cliente quiere ampliar su producción ganadera ya que le ha estado generando buenos ingresos económicos para ello requiere el presente crédito para que pueda comprar un terreno agrícola a un precio bajo. Ya que si el cliente no contara con este crédito no podría realizar sus objetivos y no podría mejorar su nivel de vida. Además mencionar que el señor Carlos es muy dedicado a su actividad.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the agrarian syndicate Colorido-Ichilo, which is part of the Santa Cruz region of the border of Cochabamba, which he managed with a great deal of effort. He lives alone and works in agriculture. He is growing citrus fruit (1/2 hectare), rice (1/2 hectare)  and has 15 cows which he sells at market.

The customer wants to increase his cattle production as it is already generating good economic income. To do this he needs the current loan so that he can buy agricultural land at a low price. If the customer couldn't have this loan he would not be able to fulfil his objectives and could not improve his quality of life. It should also be noted that Carlos is very dedicated to his work.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Saren is aged 27 years and married with one young son. She lives in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Bakan district earning a living through farming rice while her husband works as a teacher to support their family. Together, they earn about 16,000 KHR per day and manage to save money for future needs as well.

Saren has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely paid back her past loans. Now, she is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to renovate her old house and use a portion of it to spend on buying chicken and ducks to raise in order to earn additional income for her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper house.

loans.use: To renovate her old house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Pert's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Sangke district, Pert is aged 28 years and married with one son. For the last ten years, she has been planting oranges to support her family while her husband is a paid construction worker. Together, they can earn about KHR29,000 per day and can save about KHR10,000 each day for their future needs.

This is the third loan for Pert with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund while the other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. Pert will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on water pumping. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow oranges successfully in order to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Ms Maria is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling plastic toys for many years. She is doing it with the support of her husband who helps her in selling them into the markets. She makes enough money to support the needs of the family members. 

Maria is a mother of five children and is liable to bear their cost of education, food and clothing. She needs to expand her business, so she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy more toys including games, cars and balls in large quantities to attract more children. This would increase her sales which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She dreams of providing her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more toys including games, cars and balls in large quantities.

loans.name: Duhije

texts.en:
Duhije, this 53-year-old married mother of three, lives in the suburbia of a little town in the northern part of the country. All of her children continue in school.

Duhije is requesting a loan of 200,000 Albanian Lek for the first time to stock up on clothing inventory items. 

She has been in the buying-selling business for the past almost ten years, and the income she has been generating has been good according to her. Duhije’s clients are residents of a nearby town. In addition to this activity, she has been making handmade embroideries and selling them to gift stores.

loans.use: To stock up on inventory items

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Karina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Ahorro es progreso” del distrito de Saylla de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 

La socia continua trabajando en una institucion publica, la socia lleva buen tiempo en su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su trabajo,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante.

La socia solicita el credito para pagar sus estudios de pos grado.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Karina belongs to the communal bank "Ahorro es progreso" ("Saving is progress") from the Saylla area of Cusco, Peru.

The member is working in a public institution, she has been in this work for a good amount of time and it is going well thanks to the effort  that she puts in every day. The member is a responsible and hard working, which is how she gets ahead.

The member is asking for the loan to pay for her post graduate studies.

The member is grateful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling her payment schedule.

loans.use: to pay for her post graduate studies.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Marleni, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Ahorro es progreso” del distrito de Saylla de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.

La socia continua dedicandose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia a la vez continua dedicandose a su negocio de restaurante,la socia se siente feliz ya que mediante sus negocios la socia puede continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como arroz,azucar para su negocio. 


La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, una mejor educación a sus hijos y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
texts.en:
The member's name is Marleni, she belongs to the community bank "Savings are progress" in the district of Saylla in the city of Cusco, Peru.

The member continues to work in the convenience store business, she has been doing this for a good amount of time, and she does well thanks to the effort she puts in each day into the business, the member also continues with her restaurant business, she is happy because through her businesses she can continue to support her family.

The member is very grateful to KIVA for letting her provide a better quality of life to her family, a better education to her children and for helping her to growth and strengthen her activities.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice and sugar.

loans.name: Juan Gualberto

texts.es:
El socio es el señor  Juan, él pertenece al banco “Ahorro es progreso” del distrito de Saylla de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 

El socio continua trabajando en una institucion publica ,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su trabajo,el socio a la vez continua con su negocio de transporte de materiales de construccion ya que el socio cuenta con un pequeño volquete,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para realizar el mantenimiento de su volquete.


El socio Juan agradece a  KIVA por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Juan is a member of the "Ahorro es progreso" ("Saving is progress") communal bank in the district of Saylla in Cusco, Peru.

He is still working for a public institution. He has had this job for a good amount of time, and it is going well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work every day. He also continues to have a business transporting construction materials, and he has a small truck. He is a responsible and persevering person, which allows him to provide for his family.

He has applied for a loan to perform maintenance on his truck.

Juan would like to thank Kiva for granting him this loan, and he is committed to complying with the established quotas.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his truck.

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
La socia continua con su negocio de venta de chicharrones ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia trabaja todos los dias en su negocio durante el dia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como carne,aceite entre otros para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Frida continues to work in her business selling chicharrones (pork rind). She has been in this business for several years, and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work every day.

She works in her business every day during the day. She is a responsible and persevering woman, which allows her to provide for her family.

She has applied for a loan to buy goods such as meat and oil, among others, for her business.

She is happy about receiving this loan and she is committed to complying with the payment of her fees.

loans.use: to buy goods such as meat and oil, among others, for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sr. De Coyllority De Arin Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Sr. de Coyllority de Arin” en la centro de poblado de Arin del distrito de Calca de la provincia de Calca. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de chicha, compra y venta de animales menores, venta de jora, venta de verduras, venta de artesanía, venta de cosméticos y otros brindan servicios. 
 
La socia Emiliana nació en el centro poblado de Arin y vive donde  nació. Su actividad económica principal de Emiliana es la agricultura y la ganadería, ella vende  verduras en diferentes mercados de las ciudades de Urubamba y Calca, ella también  se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. En esta oportunidad Emiliana requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono. 
 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Sr. de Coyllority de Arin" is made up of a group of neighbors and friends in the center of the town of Arin, which is located in the district and province of Calca. This communal bank is made up of several people who search for opportunities to move forward in every moment. With their daily effort, they hope to give a better future to their children. 

The business activities of the members include selling chicha (a sweet drink made of corn), buying and selling small animals, and selling maize, vegetables, artisan crafts, and cosmetics, and offering services.

Emiliana was born in the town center of Arin, and she lives in the same place where she was born. Her main business activities are agriculture and livestock. She sells vegetables in different markets in the cities of Urubamba and Calca. She also raises small livestock, such as guinea pigs and chickens. Emiliana needs this loan to buy seeds and manure.

The members are grateful for this opportunity and they are committed to paying their fees at the established times.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Cynthia Pamela

texts.es:
Cynthia es una joven de 18 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, Cynthia no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía que desea, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su Madre, Cynthia trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto trabajando y cree que el va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Cynthia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea refaccionar y la pintar la fachada de su hogar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Cynthia is 18 years old and single.  She lives in the city of Imperial with her parents and siblings.  She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic young woman who has a great desire to move ahead in life.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of money and the need to work to support her parents, Cynthia was not able to study agriculture as she had wanted to.  In her spare time she spends a little time reading and sometimes she cooks a mouth-watering traditional stew with served with a dried potato soup to share with her family.

With a lot of dedication and determination, and thanks to the support of her mother, Cynthia works as a field labourer on an agricultural farm in her city.  She works every day from early in the morning for around eight hours.  She likes working and thinks it is going well because of her determination and her friendly manner with others.

Cynthia is very grateful to Kiva lenders and, thanks to the help provided, she will be able to make improvements to her home.  She wants to refurbish and paint the front of the house.  Then she will be able to continue work and putting in the effort to achieve her big dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Carlos Agusto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos  de 33 años de edad es soltero, no  tiene  hijos  que dependen de él, vive en casa de su madre, ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 06 años al negocio de venta de agua en porras  y tiene un molino de moler maíz.
Don Carlos  sus clientes  son los vecinos y amigos que viene a su casa a moler el maíz y también en la madrugada sale a vender el agua en su coche.
Don Carlos  está solicitando el préstamo para compra de repuestos del molino y para terminar de reparar  una cerca de maya  de su casa necesita alambre, madera, clavos, etc. 
Don Carlos está muy contento de trabajar con Prisma y este es el quinto préstamo que solicita.
Don Carlos su deseo es seguir trabajando para salir adelante en su actividad generadora de ingresos.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013
texts.en:
Carlos is 33 years old and single. He does not have children that depend on him and he lives at his mother's home located in a community outside of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. He has had a business selling water for six years and has a corn mill. 

Carlos' customers are his neighbors and friends that come to his home to grind their corn and he also goes out at dawn to sell water from his car. Carlos is requesting this loan to buy spare parts for the mill and to finish repairing a chicken wire fence at home. He needs wire, wood, nails, etc. 

Carlos is very happy to work with Prisma and this is his fifth loan. Carlos' wish is to continue working to get ahead in his income generating work.

loans.use: to buy wires, wood, nails and spare parts for a mill for his home and business.

loans.name: Juana Rosario

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida,  ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Juana trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de caldo de gallina, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, Juana se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Juana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como cemento, fierros, pintura, ladrillos y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder culminar los acabados de su vivienda, de esta manera Juan podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de darles una buena educación a sus hijos y desea verlos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Juana is a 37 year old woman. She lives in the city of Pisco with her two children, who she loves and who are her main reason for living. She is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all her strength to moving her family forward. Since she is both mother and father for her children, unfortunately because lack of economic resources and because of the need to work afford her expenses, she was not able to studying nursing as she hoped, but she wanted very much to do that. In her free time, she likes to play sports, and occasionally to cook a delicious rice with duck to share with her family.
By her own initiative, with much persistence and dedication, Juana works in her small business selling chicken soup. She works every day from the early hours of the morning and does so for about 12 hours. Juana is happy doing her work and believes that she does well because of her good flavoring as well as the kind treatment she gives her customers.
Juana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the support they gave she will be able to purchase construction materials, such as cement, iron, paint, bricks, and others, which will serve well to be able to complete the finishings of her household. In this way Juana will be able to offer better security and well-being to her family. Thus, she will continue working and striving to achieve her big dream to give her children a good education and to see them become skilled professionals.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gisella Maria

texts.es:
Gisella es una mujer de 39 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que ella es padre y madre para él; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Gisella no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Gisella trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Gisella se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea construir paredes para hacer a división entre su negocio y hogar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gisella is 39 years old and lives in the city of Ica with her son, whom she loves and who is her main reason for living.  Gisella is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts into making her son prosper.  She is both father and mother to him.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work in order to cover costs, Gisella was not able to study, even though she would very much have liked to.  In her spare time, Gisella likes to watch films and, on occasion, she prepares a delicious "ají de gallina" (a traditional Peruvian, chicken-based dish) to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, and with a lot of determination and dedication, Gisella has a small business selling groceries.  She work every day from early in the morning, for around eight hours.  She likes her work and thinks that it is going well because of her good prices and the friendly service she gives to customers.

Gisella is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the support provided, she will be able to improve her home.  She wants to build a wall in order to separate her business and her home.  Then she will continue working and putting in a lot of effort to achieve her dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Zoila Rosalina

texts.es:
Zoila es una mujer de 56 años, vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Zoila no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, ya que soñaba con ser una gran Maestra de escuela, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Zoila trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que ofrece a sus clientes.
Zoila se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como calaminas, ladrillos, clavos, arenas y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder mejorar su vivienda, ya que se acercan las épocas de lluvias y necesita reforzar su hogar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose  lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Zoila is a 56-year-old woman, who lives in the city of Aguaytia with her husband and three children. Her love for them drives everything she does. Zoila is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person. Together with her husband, she dedicates all of her effort to helping her family get ahead. Unfortunately, due to financial hardship, Zoila had to start working at a very young age and was not able to continue her studies through high school. She had always wished she could have studied, since she dreamed of becoming a teacher.  

In her free time, Zoila enjoys reading and on special occasions she cooks her delicious Ají de Gallina (a typical Peruvian chicken dish) for her family. By her own initiative and with much hard work and dedication, Zoila works in her small grocery store each day from the early hours of the morning through eight-hour work days. She enjoys this work and believes it has gone so well for her because of the competitive prices she offers and the kind way she treats her customers. 

Zoila is very grateful for this Kiva loan. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to buy construction materials, such as corrugated iron, bricks, nails, sand, etc. These will help her to improve her home before the rainy season comes. Zoila will continue working toward her dream of seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente José no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, ya que soñaba con estudiar su carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Saltado de Repollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, José trabaja como maestro constructor en diversas obras de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos acabados de los trabajos que realiza.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra herramientas de trabajo, como una carretilla, cubos, lampas, martillos y otros, de esta manera José contará con las herramientas necesarias para realizar sus trabajos, así pues él seguirá esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio y así seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
José is a 30-year-old man, who lives in the city of Camaná with his two children. His love for them drives everything he does. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person. He dedicates all of his effort to helping his family get ahead. Unfortunately, José was not able to continue his studies through high school, though he would have liked to since he dreamed of studying a professional career. 

In his free time, José enjoys watching movies and on special occasions he cooks a delicious Saltado de Repollo (a typical Peruvian dish with sautéd cabbage) for his family. By his own initiative and with much hard work and dedication, José works as a master builder in various places in his city. He works each day from the early hours of the morning through ten-hour work days. He enjoys this work and believes it has gone so well for him because of the good-quality work he does.

José is very grateful for this Kiva loan. It will enable him to buy work tools, such as a wheelbarrow, buckets, pickaxes, hammers, and others. These will help him in his business so he can continue working hard to achieve his dream of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 32 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación;  lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Luz no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Pachamanca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luz trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Luz se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, como arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas, golosinas y otros, de esta manera Luz tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Luz is a 32-year-old, single woman. She lives in the city of Chincha. Luz is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with big dreams of excelling. Unfortunately, due to financial hardship, Luz had to to work in order to make ends meet, so she was not able to go to college and study Law like she'd hoped. 

In her free, Luz enjoys listening to music and, on special occasions, she cooks her delicious Pachamanca (a typical Peruvian dish) to share with her family. By her own initiative, and with much hard work and dedication, Luz works in a small grocery store. She works 10-hour days, each day from the early hours of the morning. Luz enjoys her work and believes that it has gone so well for her due to the competitive prices she offers and the kind way she treats her customers. 

Luz is very grateful for the opportunity this Kiva loan gives her. With it, she will buy larger quantities of merchandise for her store such as rice, sugar, oil, sodas, candy, and other items. In this way, Luz will keep her store better stocked and will be able to serve more customers. She will continue working hard to reach her goal of becoming a professional one day.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Victoria Basilia

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer de 60 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposo, tiene 2 hijos a quienes y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo quien trabaja como obrero de tejidos, dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Victoria no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar, en especial prepara un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Victoria trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, tubérculos y bebidas, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Victoria se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, menestras, gaseosas, tubérculos y otros, de esta manera Victoria tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 60 year old woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her husband. She has two children who she loves and are her main focus in life. She is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who works together with her husband in weaving. They put all their efforts into moving their family forward. Unfortunately because of a lack of economic resources and the need to work since she was very young, Victoria could not study for a Nursing degree like she wanted to and would have enjoyed being able to. In her free time she likes to cook, especially the delicious "Ají de Gallina" to share with her family. 

Upon her own initiative and with a lot of perseverance and dedication, Victoria works in her small store where she sells groceries, tubers and drinks. She works everyday from very early in the morning and works up to 12 hours a day. She feels very happy to do her work and believes that it is going well for her because of her good prices and friendly manner that she shows toward her customers. 

Victoria is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help brought forth she will be able to buy merchandise in larger quantities, including rice, sugar, oil, milk, beans, soft drinks, tubers and other items. In this way, Victoria will have her business well stock and be able to attend to more customers. She will continue working and putting in the effort to achieve her great dream of finishing the construction of her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una mujer de 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Imperial con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que ella es padre y madre para su hijo; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su padres, Gabriela pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de cosmetología, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear con su pequeño por las acogedoras calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su Madre, Gabriela trabaja día a día en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja por un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Gabriela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de 2 vitrinas, las cuales le servirán de mucho para poder exhibir mejor sus productos, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder ampliar su negocio y tener su propio negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a 30 year old woman who lives in the city of Imperial with her small son who she loves and is her main focus in life. She is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic woman who puts all her strength into getting her child ahead because she has to be mother and father for her son. Thanks to her own efforts and her parents support, Gabriela was able to study Cosmetology. In her free time she likes to pass through the streets of her city with her son. She sometimes cooks the delicious "Carapulcra con Sopa Seca" to share with her family. 

With much perseverance, dedication and thanks to her mother's support, Gabriela works everyday in her small grocery store. She works about 10 hours daily and believes that it is going well for her because of her good prices and the friendliness with which she treats her customers. 

Gabriela is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help brought forth, she will be able to buy two display cases which will help her a lot in displaying her products better. She will continue working and putting in the effort to achieve her most sought after dream of expanding her business and have her own business selling food.

loans.use: to buy two display cases.

loans.name: Santa Isabel

texts.es:
Santa vive en las Orquídeas, tiene 33 años de edad. Ella dice que escogió esta actividad de venta de comesticos porque si deja ganancia y también le facilita para estar más tiempo en su hogar junto a sus hijos.

Este trabajo lo realiza sola en diferentes horarios, sale a venderles a sus clientes de casa en casa, para así poder pagar los gastos del hogar y los de los estudios de sus hijos.

Teme enfermarse por lo que es una mujer separada de su esposo, que sola lucha por sacar adelante a sus tres hijos que son menores de edad y que estudian en una escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cosmeticos, perfumes, ropa. En el futuro la clienta quiere poder terminar de mejorar su vivienda e invertir en más productos para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Santa Isabel, 33, lives in Las Orquídeas.  She says she chose the line of work selling cosmetic items because it nets good profits and it allows her to spend more time at home with her children.  The work she does is on a varied schedule.  She goes out to sell to her customers house to house in order to be able to pay her household expenses and pay for her children’s schooling.  She fears becoming ill because she’s separated from her husband and she’s the only one striving to move her minor children ahead and seeing that they attend public school.  She will use the loan to buy cosmetics, perfume and clothes.  In future, she wants to finish improving her house and invest in more things to sell.

loans.use: cosmeticos, perfumes, ropa

loans.name: Delmis Marina

texts.es:
La señora Delmis  de 41  años de edad,   tiene 02  hijos   que dependan  de ella, vive con su esposo en casa propia,  ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 11  años al negocio de venta de pan de todas las clases.
Doña Delmis sus clientes son los amigos, vecinos y personas que comercializan con este producto, sale junto con su esposo en su carro a vender por los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo y lugares aledaños, es una mujer trabajadora y con deseos de superarse.
Doña Delmis está solicitando el préstamo para compra  de harina, huevos, soda, sal, margarina, leche, etc.  Y así  mejorar su negocio, con el apoyo del préstamo  pretende mejorar un poco sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con PRISMA.
Doña Delmis su sueño es mejorar su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013.
texts.en:
Delmis is 41 years old and has two children who depend on her. She lives with her husband in their own house located in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She has had her business for 11 years selling all types of bread. 

Delmis' clients are her friends, neighbors and people who distribute her products. She goes out with her husband in their car to sell in the neighborhoods and communities of San Lorenzo and the neighboring areas. She is a hard working woman with a great desire to get ahead. 

Delmis is requesting this loan to buy flour, eggs, baking soda, salt, margarine, milk, etc. With the support of this loan she will improve her business and work to improve her earnings a little bit and in turn, improve her quality of life. She is very happy to continue working with PRISMA. Delmis' dream is to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking soda, salt, margarine, milk, etc for her business.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ALFREDO, es una persona de 30 años de edad de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su propio domicilio, cuenta con tres dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus pequeños hijos; la actividad económica principal a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola; produce papa, oca, haba, arveja y cebada  en sus propios terrenos agrícolas y especialmente la papa en compañía (es decir en terrenos de otra persona la misma dispone el terreno, parte de semilla y los clientes la mano de obra e insumos utilizados en la agricultura y a la cosecha el rendimiento se dividen en partes iguales), los terrenos mencionados se hallan situadas en la comunidad de T'oqo Rancho del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 70 Km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Asimismo como segunda actividad económica alternativa el cliente presta sus servicios de constructor (albañil) jornalero por el cual genera ingresos económicos adicionales. Y finalmente el cliente y su esposa manifiestan tener ganas de poder mejorar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de abono de gallinaza para la próxima gestión agrícola y de tal forma asegurar su producción.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 30 years old, married, and managed to complete primary school. He lives in his own house and has 3 dependents, his wife and 2 young children. His principal economic activity is agricultural production. Alfredo grows potatoes, beans, green peas, and barley, plus he raises geese on his own agricultural land. Moreover, he grows potatoes “in company” (that is, on land provided by another person who also provides a portion of the seeds, the customers, the field hands, and the inputs needed, in exchange for a division of the harvest in equal parts. The plots mentioned are located in the community of Toqo Rancho in the municipality of Tiraque, some 70 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.

In addition, Alfredo's 2nd economic activity is to work as a bricklayer in order to generate added income.

At present, Alfredo and his wife wish to be able to improve their agricultural production and to do that, they need investment capital to purchase chicken manure for the next harvest, so as to guarantee their production.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Juan José  tiene 21 años de edad, vive en la zona de Chacacollo  carretera antigua a Sacaba una Provincia ubicado al este de la Ciudad de Cochabamba.
Él trabaja con su volqueta en el traslado de agregados en la zona. Juan José aún vive con sus padres, él tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven ya que su padre se fue a España y su madre se quedó sola con sus hermanos y ella tenía una granja de cerdos la cual está ubicado en Cliza y a veces Juan José se quedaba en la granja para poder dar la alimentación y el cuidado a los cerdos ya que era su única fuente de ingreso.
Juan José se encuentra estudiando la carrera de ingeniería petrolera, el aprovecha todas las noches y madrugadas para tomar sus clases y de esa  forma salir adelante.  El Sr. Juan José solicita el crédito para la compra de tanque de gas para su volqueta ya que con gasolina gasta aún más, es una persona trabajadora y dedicada a su actividad.
texts.en:
Juan José is 21 years and lives in the Chacacollo area, on the old road to Sacaba, which is a province located to the east of the city of Cochabamba.

Juan works with his dumper lorry, moving aggregate in the area.  He still lives with his parents and had to work from a very young age as his father went to Spain and his mother stayed at home with his brothers.  His mother has a pig farm in Cliza and sometimes Juan used to stay at the farm to feed and look after the pigs, as this was their only source of income.

Juan is studying petroleum engineering and he takes advantage of every night and early morning to take his classes and so prosper.  Juan is applying for a loan to buy a gas tank for his dumper lorry as he spends even more with petrol.  He is a hard-working person who is dedicated to his job.

loans.use: to buy a tank for a dumper lorry.

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es: Buenas Tardes: El grupo “Las Orquideas” está conformada por 09 mujeres trabajadores, la cual pasan a su 4to ciclo, la gran mayoría vecinos de la zona. Betty  de 47 años, es viuda con 05 hijos 03 de ellos en etapa escolar. Betty brinda servicio de costura, como actividad segundaria se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos la cual lo realiza a pedidos.  Estas actividades le han permitido apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios, pues unos de sus metas son de ver a sus hijos profesionales.  Con el fin de seguir apoyando a sus hijos solicito el crédito ya que lo destinará para gastos de útiles escolares. Betty es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste polo plomo y pantalón negro. El grupo “Las Orquideas” agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The "Las Orquideas" group is made up of nine hard working women who are entering in their fourth loan cycle. The majority of them are neighbors. Betty is 47 years old and is a widow with five children, three of whom are in school. 

Betty offers seamstress services and as a secondary activity weaves goods which she makes by order. These activities have allowed her to support her children's schooling. One of her goals is to see her children become professionals. With the purpose of continuing to support her children she is requesting the loan which she will use for school supplies. Betty is the third from the left dressed in the grey shirt and black pants. The "Las Orquideas" group is thankful for the loan provided because it makes it possible for them to move forward.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto desde hace 2 años y en todo este tiempo ha fortalecido su amistad con sus compañeras. Vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeado de montañas que nos regala hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y varios salen a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades.

Doña Luz tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos de 17, 13, 10, 8 y 6 años de edad, dos de sus hijos están estudiando en el colegio y sus tres estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.

La Señora Luz se dedica a la cría de ganado, gallinas, borregos y cuyes, cultiva sus terrenos y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa y si existe un sobrante lo vende, también hay ocasiones que trabaja como empleada domestica.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus terrenos y en alimento para sus animales. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Luz has been a member of the communal bank 14 de Agosto for two years, during which time she has formed good friendships with the other members.
She lives near the parish of Zhidmad, located in Cuenca, which is surrounded by spectacular landscapes formed by the surrounding mountains. Residents of this area mainly work raising animals, farming, or working in the nearby city.

Luz is 35 years old. She lives in a civil marriage, from which she has five children ages 17, 13, 10, 8, and 6 years old. Two of her children are studying in high school and three study in their local elementary school. Luz's husband works in construction and they own their own house. 

Luz makes a living raising cattle, chickens, sheep, and guinea pigs. She farms on her own land and feeds her family from this produce. Luz also sells any excess produce she grows and on occasion works as a housekeeper. 

She will invest this loan to buy fertilizers for her land and feed for her animals.

Her dream is that one day her children will become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: María Purificacion

texts.es:
La Señora María forma parte del banco comunal 14 de Agosto desde hace 5 años, en todo este tiempo se ha fortalecido los lasos de amistad con todas sus vecinas y amigas del sector. Vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeado de montañas que nos regala hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y varios salen a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades.

La Señora María tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y fruto de unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 22, 19 y 18 años, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su segunda hija le ayuda en los quehaceres de su hogar y su tercer hijo se encuentra estudiando en un colegio de la localidad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico y tiene un taller.

Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar pero es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que trabaja en el campo, sus cosechas las vende en la comunidad o son para el consumo de su hogar, cría cuyes, pollos y ganado del cual comercializa la leche. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y semillas de hierba para el mejoramiento de sus huertos y sus potreros, también va a comprar alimento para sus animales. 

Su sueño es  tener un negocio en su casa como una tienda.
texts.en:
María has been a member of the communal bank, 14 de Agosto, for five years. During which time, she has formed good friendships with her neighbors and fellow members. She lives near the parish Zhidmad, located in Cuenca. The surrounding mountains form breathtaking landscapes in this area. Residents mainly work raising animals, farming, or traveling to the city to work.

María is 47 years old. She is married and has three children ages 22, 19, and 18. Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently. María's second daughter helps her with the work at home, while her youngest studies in a local high school. María's husband works as a mechanic and has his own repair shop. 

María makes a living working the land by her house as well as taking care of the household chores. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. María's crops feed her family and also are sold in her community. She raises guinea pigs, chickens, and cattle, from which she sells milk. 

She will invest this loan to buy fertilizer and the seeds of herbs to improve her gardens and pastures, as well as feed for her animals. 

Her dream is to open a store from her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds of herbs, and animal feed.

loans.name: María Martha

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto del cual es la presidenta. Vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeado de montañas que regalan hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y varios salen a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades.

La Señora. María tiene 49 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, tres de ellos ya son casados y viven independientes, y su ultima hija estudia en una colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña María ha sacado adelante a toda su familia gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, también se dedica a la elaboración y venta de halados.

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de semillas de alfalfa y animales de los cuales obtuvo muy buenas ganancias, ella pago su crédito sin dificultad y en las fechas indicadas. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono, semillas y víveres para la elaboración de sus helados. La banca comunal le gusta por el compañerismo del grupo.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank “14 de Agosto” [14th of August] and is its president. She lives in the parish of Zhidmad in Cuenca, which is surrounded by mountains that provide beautiful landscapes. The people who live there work at rearing animals, agriculture and several go to the city to work in different activities.

María is 49 years old and is married. Her marriage has borne her 4 children, three of whom are now married themselves and live independently. Her last daughter studies in a college in the city. Her husband works in construction. They live in their own house.

María has kept her whole family going thanks to her hard work and dedication. She works rearing animals and in agriculture; she also makes and sells ice-cream.

She invested her last loan buying alfalfa seeds and animals, from which she made a very good earnings. She paid off her loan without any difficulty and to schedule. She will invest her new loan in buying fertiliser and seeds, and ingredients to make her ice-creams. She likes the communal bank because of the support from the group.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and seeds, as well as ingredients

loans.name: Virgencita  Del  Carmen - Los Incas Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Virgencita del Carmen - Los Inkas” en la ciudad del Cusco del distrito de Cusco de la provincia del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de mochilas, venta de ferretería, venta de panes, venta de comestibles, venta de comida y otros brindan servicio de mecánica.

La socia Sayda tiene 27 años y es soltera. Sayda es técnico en farmacia  pero trabaja para entidad privada, ella trabaja hace varios meses entonces le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar matriculas de una especialización. (la socia Sayda esta levantando la mano en la fotografia). 
 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbours formed the Communal bank "Virgencita del Carmen- the Incas" in the city of Cusco, in the district and province of Cusco. This Communal bank is formed of various people who continually search for the opportunities to get ahead, and with their daily effort to give their children a better future. The economic activities of the members are, for example; selling backpacks, selling hardware, selling bread, selling groceries, selling food, and others offer their services as mechanics. 

Sayda is a 27 year old member, and is single. She is a technician in a pharmacy but she works for a private company. She has worked there for a few months and she is getting on well. She requires a loan to pay course fees for a specialization. (Sayda is the member who is raising her hand in the photograph). 

The members as a group are grateful for the opportunity given to them and promise to meet the payments of their instalments within the time limits.

loans.use: to pay course fees for a specialization.

loans.name: Kutimuy Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “Kutimuy” se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el ciclo 21  y está conformado por varias personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a lo que se dedican son a las ventas de chocolates, comestibles, materiales de construcción, confección de manualidades y otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo, guía de turismo,  agencia de transportes, empleado administrativo y enfermera. 

Carmen continúa con la tienda de abarrotes donde vende diferentes tipos de comestibles. Ya son varios  años que se dedica al negocio y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo,  Ella requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos azúcar, fideos, cerveza y gaseosas. 

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido. (La socia que está en la parte inferior de la fotografía llego tarde a la reunión).
texts.en:
The members of the "Kutimuy" communal bank meet every thirty days in the offices of the microfinance arm of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. The communal bank is now in its 21st loan cycle and is made up of several hard working and entrepreneurial people. They seek opportunities in every moment to get ahead and with their daily efforts offer a better future to their children. 

The economic activities of some of the members include the sale of chocolates, food, construction material, production of artisan crafts and other members offer services including tour guides, transportation, administrative employment and nursing. 

Carmen continues with her grocery store where she sells several types of foods. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well for her thanks to the perseverance that she puts into her work. She needs a loan to increase her working capital and wishes to buy merchandise including sacks of rice and sugar, noodles, beer and soft drinks. 

The members value and are thankful for the loan provided through these means and are committed to making their loan installments on time. The member that is in the bottom part of the photo arrived late to the meeting.

loans.use: to buy merchandise including sacks of rice and sugar, noodles, beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Srey Lorn

texts.en: Srey Lorn is 37 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling furniture for more than two years, earning approximately $10 daily. Her daughter (who is joining her in the picture) is a police officer who earns about $2 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey Lorn requests a loan of $1000 to purchase more furniture to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at the market and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it much stronger to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more furniture to resell.

loans.name: Youern

texts.en:
Youern, 47, is married and has one daughter who currently is helping with the household chores. She and her family are residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. 

She has three hectares of farmland to grow rice as the primary source of income. She also runs a small stall for selling grocery items to supplement her income. In her ten-year engagement in this business, she is able to earn up to 23,800 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Yoeurn has taken the business loan for ages, the past six cycles. She has succeeded in paying back her loan, which has helped her to unburden her financial issues in supporting her business and upgrade her standard of living. 

Now, she is seeking 4,000,000 KHR in this new cycle. She will use some portion of her loan to lease an additional plot of farmland to grow more rice and part of her loan to buy grocery items for resale. 

She hopes to increase her income from her current businesses so that she can maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: to lease an additional plot of farmland and to buy grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Phany

texts.en: Phany is 27 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is a construction worker who makes an income of $6 per day. In order to improve her husband’s business, Phany requests a loan of $500 to purchase more construction tools for her husband to use in his work. This purchase will help him obtain enough tools to use and acquire the ability to bid for a bigger construction project. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his work.

loans.name: Loum's Group

texts.en: A rural villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Loum is 30 years old and married. She is blessed with four children who still depend on her as they are in school. As one of the breadwinners in the family, she feeds her family with great support from her husband physically and emotionally. They farm four hectares each of rice and sesame. The shortage of working capital to support her farmland is her main challenge. She has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. She is 4,000,000 KHR and her co-borrower is requesting 2,000,000 KHR. As a group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy potash for her cash-crops. She hopes to gain greater yield from her crops so that she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy potash for her cash-crops

loans.name: Sovannary's Group

texts.en:
Sovannary is a 30-year-old mother of two daughters who are still in school. She is a grocery shop owner in her village, selling various kinds of items in order to earn a living for the family’s sake. She has been in this business for 10 years. To supplement the family income, her husband also works for others for a fee.

Sovannary has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages. Her past six loans have been completely repaid already. These past loans have made a positive impact, upgrading her lifestyle progressively. Now, she is in a group of two applying for 1,400,000 riels each. As the group leader, she will use her portion to buy more grocery items for resale including salt, eggs, instant noodles, spices, etc. She hopes to replenish her grocery items in good time so that she can absorb more clients and earn more profit for her family – especially so that she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for resale

loans.name: Sreynit

texts.en: Age 49 and a mother of one schoolgirl, Sreynit is a rural villager from Kampong Cham province. She has owned three business, rice cropping, animal raising, and clothes selling. Engaging in this business for eight years, she is able to earn about USD $3 per day. This is the second loan for Sreynit. She has repaid back her first loan already. The first loan enabled her to better support her farmland, cover the daily food consumption in her household, and keep her children in school. Now, she has a good standard of living. She will use her loan to buy clothes and shoes for resale. She hopes this will help her to make more profit so that she can cover her child’s education and set aside some money in order to buy a decent motorbike to support her business as well as her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Solongo

texts.en:
Solongo is a 35-year-old widow who lives with her son and mother in the outer ger district, which lacks basic infrastructure, of the city. She supports her family by operating a tailoring business, while her mother stays at home and looks after her 13-year-old son when Solongo is not at home. 

When Solongo first began her business, she had only one sewing machine, but now she has three sewing machines and has hired one more tailor. Currently, she has so many subscriptions and she needs two types of sewing machines. 

Solongo is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase two types of sewing machines in order to increase her business income.

loans.use: to purchase two types of sewing machines.

loans.name: Soeng's Group

texts.en:
As one breadwinner in a family consisting of three children, Soeng, age 43, is a rice farmer. She does a rice cropping business on two hectares of farmland, with support from her husband, as their primary source of income. It is a business that she has been with for 10 years. 

For Soeng, this is her sixth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is in a group of five members applying for a new loan. Her co-borrowers are on their first to fourth cycles with VisionFund. Soeng has managed her past loans wisely to upgrade her standard of living at a good pace. Now, the total requested loan amount for her group is 6,000,000 riels (KHR). Soeng will use her loan portion of 1,400,000 KHR to buy potash and pesticide and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes to replant her rice on time and get a high yield in order to maintain her living situation.

loans.use: to buy potash and pesticide and to pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Originally from Pursat Province’s Kror Kor District, Chen is 49 years old and married. She is blessed with five children: four of them are students while the remaining one is a paid worker in Thailand. To tackle the family’s financial burden, she farms on two hectares of land and her husband works as a paid worker. This couple also owns a small rice huller to earn more income. The main challenges for her family are the insufficiency of working capital to support her business. 

To deal with her challenges, Chen is applying for a fourth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loans, which she fully repaid, have steadily sustained her business and returned a good income to support her family with decent food. Now, she is seeking an 1,800,000 riel loan in order to fix her rice husker. She hopes to fix her machine as soon as possible so she can provide this paid service to the villagers for additional income for her family.

loans.use: to fix her rice husker

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en: Chea, 42, is a widowed mother of three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a resident of Battambang province. She is employed and also grows rice in order to support her family as a single mother. She has been growing rice for ten years, and is able to earn up to 20,300 KHR per day. Her main challenge is the low crop yield due to pests. Hence, she has formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. She is a three-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) who has repaid her last loan with VisionFund already. She feels so confident that she can uplift her living conditions gradually after the successful past loan. Now, she and one of her co-borrowers are seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each while the remaining member is requesting 1,000,000 KHR. For Chea, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes that this crop will return her a good yield so she can earn more income to maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Teb's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Teb is 40-years-old and married with three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice on 1.5-hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for 6 years, Teb can earn about 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is the first loan for Teb with VisionFund. She is the leader of her group of three and wants to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her harvest so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann is a hard working father of one daughter. He is also a resident of Battamang Province, Cambodia. To support themselves, he and his wife do rice farming as their core income generating business. To earn extra profit, his wife also sells sweets. He has been involved in this business for several years.

Vann has just joined VisionFund this cycle as a first time borrower. He is seeking for 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer for his rice farm.
