Some portion of his loan will also go to buy necessary ingredients for his wife to make sweets that she can sell. He hopes to make more profit from this dual income so that he can gradually improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his rice farm

loans.name: Sony's Group

texts.en: A mother of two schoolchildren and one younger child residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sony is 32 years old. She grows rice and plants pineapple as the main source of income in order to meet her family’s daily requirements. She has 10 years involvement in her current business and it returns her about 20,000 KHR per day. Sony, a second-time borrower, joins a group with a fourth-time borrower to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has succeeded in maintaining her lifestyle in a good manner from the first loan which she has successfully repaid. Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking 500,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. As a group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy potash for her pineapple seedlings. She hopes to grow her pineapple fruitfully so that she can double the yield and make more income to buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her cash-crop growing business.

loans.use: To buy potash for her pineapple seedlings.

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
Leng is aged 40 years and married with one daughter. They live in a village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. Her daughter is still in school. 

To make a living, Leng has been farming rice on two hectares. She is able to earn about 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Leng has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

Leng, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully, so as to make a better living and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry is 53 years old and a citizen from Battambang province(Cambodia). She is married and has 8 children. Currently, only four of her children still count on her as they are students in the local state school. To manage the daily cost of living, she has been growing corn and rice for more than 13 years.

Including this loan, she has taken 4 loans with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) and has completely repaid her past loans. Her subsequent loans have supported her business and gradually uplifted her lifestyle. Now, she is seeking a loan for 4,000,000 KHR. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her two cash-crops. She hopes to make additional income from her current business so that she can keep her four children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cash-crops

loans.name: Roeurb's Group

texts.en:
Roeun earns a living selling ice cream. She has two children, one on whom she supports because she is still in school. To supplement the family income, her husband works for others for a fee. 

Roeun has engaged in this business for five years and is able to earn up to 16,700 Cambodian riels (KHR). Her past six loans have been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She has wisely used her loans to sustain her living at a good pace. Now, she is in need of working capital to support her business, so she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. 

She is seeking 600,000 KHR, while her joint borrower is seeking 300,000 KHR. She will use her portion to buy ice cream for resale. She hopes to earn more income from her current business to maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy ice cream for resale

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel is a 41-year-old widow who lives with her two sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. Their ger is located in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia, in an area without basic infrastructure. Both of her sons attend the local secondary school.

From 1994 to 2004, Odgerel operated an ice cream selling business. Since 2009, she has been operating a grocery selling business at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She purchases her products from other wholesale suppliers. 

Spring is a high shopping season in our country, so every entrepreneur such as Odgerel needs more products to sell. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to purchase grocery products to sell in her small stall. Furthermore, she wishes to expand her business and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to sell.

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Srey Snom district, La is aged 30 years and married with two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice on 4 hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for several years, La manages to earn about 10,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and can save about 5,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

La has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. She successfully paid back the past loans. Now she is now leading her group of four to request a loan. As the leader, La will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to get a high yield from her rice paddy so as to sell it for a good price to better her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Lin's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Lin is 30 years old and married.  She has one daughter.  She has been farming rice on 1 hectare of farmland for five years.  The current business earns her about 10,000 KHR per day and allows her to save about 5,000 KHR per day after expenses. 

Lin’s group consists of three members who live in the same village.  This is her 5th loan with VisionFund.  She completely paid back her previous loans which have helped her to better support her current business.  Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to buy piglets to raise.  She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and piglets.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Tsestegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsetsegmaa is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in Ulaanbaatar city with her family.  She supports her family by operating a sewing business since 1994.  When she first began her business, it was very hard, since the Mongolian market was very unsteady. 

Year by year, she became more experienced in this kind of business and was able to attract more customers.  Most of her customers are very satisfied with her work.  She needs one more sewing machine in order to sew more items (clothes, jackets, trousers, etc) and is requesting a loan for 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks).

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en: Ms. Gulshan is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She has been successfully running a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She is a very energetic and ambitious woman and strives hard to contribute to the family income. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. In order to cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she applied a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more spools of threads and packs of sequins and stones for embellishments.  She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend a part of the revenues on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads and packs of sequins and stones for embellishments

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Ms. Sajida is a 42-year-old married woman.  She is successfully running a business of hand embroidery in her house despite having six children. She is a very energetic and ambitious woman who wants to improve the standard of living of her family by raising her income level. That’s why she started a business of hand-embroidery to provide the basic needs of food, education, and health of her children. Her husband‘s income is not sufficient to meet the household expenses alone. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf foundation. She has been in association with Kashf for eight years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Currently she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads, and packs of sequins, beads, and pearls in various colors.  This way she will be able to cater to more customers which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, packs of sequins, beads, and pearls in various colors

loans.name: Tserenchimed

texts.en:
Borrower Tserenchimed is a 32-year-old single lady who lives with her younger sister and mother in a ger, a traditional felt tent, which is located in the area of the city that lacks basic infrastructure. 

Tserenchimed specialized as a maths teacher in 2004. Her mother is retired, while her sister is a tailor at a local tailoring factory. Tserenchimed works as a receptionist besides her lessons.

Currently, Tserenchimed is studying again at the Institute of Finance and Economy, and this loan will be used for her tuition fee. Her aim is to finish her Institute studies successfully and to get a good salaried job.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Davaasuren is a 47-year-old married man who has two children. He lives with his family in the outer ger district, which lacks basic infrastructure, of the city. He is a crane man, while his spouse works as a teacher at a local primary school.  His elder son is a workman, and his daughter attends high school. 

Davaasuren is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase construction and housing materials to finish his house and garage.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en: Ms. Zakia is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various items and goods for everyday use. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. Her husband is a sales-person. She is the mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to expand her business so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy a stock of cleaning products such as detergents, soaps, and other grocery items in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her children’s education and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products such as detergents,soaps, and other grocery items in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand at her store

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Ms. Shahnaz is a 42-year-old woman; she had a difficult time after her husband's death. 

Twelve years ago, Shahnaz began sewing work in her house and sews clothes for the people living around her house. She uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to the lack of availability of funds, Shahnaz is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy raw material, including cloth, thread of different colors, and laces and zippers in various colors to create a means of increasing revenues. In this way, she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. 

Shahnaz is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She dreams of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, thread of different colors, and laces and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Ms. Shameem is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last six years. She offers various goods for daily use and has attained a regular list of customers. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.

In order to make her store fully stocked, Shameem requested a loan of Rs 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. This will help her to purchase stock of sugar, flour and grains from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet with the increasing demand consistently. 

Shameem is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, flour and grains from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Fardos

texts.en:
Ms. Fardos is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband drives a rickshaw and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

Fardos is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Zatooni

texts.en:
Ms. Zatooni is 51 years old and the mother of five children.  For the past 10 years, she has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to help support her family when her husband was the only breadearner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one calf. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. 

Ms. Zatooni helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to Kashf Foundation to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Mui

texts.en:
Mui was born in 1969. She has two children. Her daughter has gotten married. Her son is a carpenter. Her husband is a worker. His income is about 6,000,000 VND.  Mui is a carpenter to earn a living. She has done this job for 10 years. She gets about 5,000,000 VND a month from it. Her family’s total earnings are about 17,000,000 VND per month. 
	
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. Her dream is to save more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela es madre de dos hijos de corta edad, trabaja como dependiente en una empresa comercial, el lugar de trabajo está a 10 kilómetros de su casa y debido a que tiene que atender a sus hijos necesita estar temprano en su hogar, razón por la cual solicita un crédito por un millón treinta y cinco mil colones (¢1.035.000) para comprar una motocicleta y transportarse en menos tiempo a su hogar, de esta manera dedicará más tiempo a su familia . Agradece la oportunidad de financiamiento que se le brinda.
texts.en: Mayela has two young children.  She works as a saleswoman at a business.  The place where she works is 10 kilometers from her house, and because she needs to care for her children, she needs to be home early.  She is requesting a loan of 1,035,000 colones to purchase a motorcycle so that she can transport herself home in less time.  This will allow her to spend more time with her family.  She is grateful for the funding opportunity that has been provided.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Ms. Sakina is a 49-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last ten years. She offers various goods for daily use and has attained a regular list of customers. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Sakina is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to expand her business, and has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She will then be able to meet with the increasing consistent  demands. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia es una señora creada en el campo, desde niña ayudó a su padre en los oficios de agrícultura y ganadería por lo que conoce muy bien todas estas labores. Ella vive con uno de sus hijos y  comprar su sustento depende de la venta de cerdos, ya que tiene una porqueriza, la cual necesita mejorar las instalaciones físicas y comprar más cerdos para continuar su proyecto y obtener más crías.
texts.en:
Herminia is a woman brought up in the country. Since childhood she helped her father with agriculture and livestock so she knows this work very well. 

She lives with one of her children and household expenses depend on the sale of pigs. She has a pigpen, which needs physical improvements to the facilities and she needs to buy more pigs in order to continue her work and to obtain more piglets.

loans.use: to buy materials in order to improve a pigpen for the pigs

loans.name: Ghulshan

texts.en: Ms. Ghulshan is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store for the last year. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She is the mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to expand her business and has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy stock of flour, sugar, packs of biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.  She is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of flour, sugar, packs of biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Ms. Shabana is a 27-year-old married woman. Three years ago she began tailoring work in her house to support the needs of the family members. She sews for the people living around her house and uses the income to contribute to the family income. Shabana is a mother of two; both of which are going to school. She is motivated to provide them with good food, health and education. 

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zippers to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a stronger source of income. She is currently in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zippers

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr: Madame Salimata  est une résidente du Sénégal. Elle est mariée et s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle est  particulièrement  connue dans la vente de chaussures et de draps. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC ou elle a déjà remboursé  un crédit antérieur.. Elle sollicite un second prêt d’un montant  de 100.000 francs CFA prévu  pour l’achat de chaussures et de draps à revendre  dans le but de pouvoir satisfaire la demande sa clientèle. Ce crédit peut lui donner la possibilité d’améliorer ses revenus grâce à l’augmentation de son fond de roulement. Son projet futur  est d’acquérir  un grand magasin  pour son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Mrs Salimata is a resident of Senegal. She is married and has been a saleswoman for over five years. She is particularly well-known in the domain of shoes and sheets sales. She is a member of one of the U-IMCEC offices where she has already repaid a previous loan. She requests a second loan of 100.000 CFA francs intended for the purchase of shoes and sheets for resale in order to satisfy her customers' demand. This loan can give her the possibility of improving her income by increasing her working capital. Her ambition is to acquire a large shop for her commercial activity.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sheets for resale.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina es una es una señora con muchos deseos de superarse, con mucho esfuerzo ha lograda hacer mejoras a su vivienda, debido a  que se acerca la época de lluvia ella está preocupada porque necesita techar el cuarto de pilas  y parte de su cocina, además de poner paredes en ambas áreas. Para esto necesita un crédito de un millón treinta y cinco mil colones (¢1.035.000)con el cual comprará materiales de construcción y pagará la mano de obra.
texts.en: Marcelina is a lady with a strong desire to succeed. Through a lot of effort she has managed to make improvements to her home. Because the rainy season is approaching she is worried because she needs a roof for the laundry room and part of the kitchen, and also to put up walls in both areas.  For this she needs a loan of one million thirty five thousand colones (1,35,000.00) with which she will buy construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa Elena tiene tres hijos agricultores, ella colabora con los oficios del campo y ayuda a su familia en todo lo que necesiten, con gran esfuerzo ha logrado construir su vivienda pero aún no la ha podido terminar, por lo que solicita un crédito de un millón treinta y cinco mil colones (¢1.035.000)para comprar el material y pagar la mano de obra, Rosa Elena quiere agilizar el trabajo de construcción ya que se acerca la época de lluvia y necesita terminar su vivienda lo antes posible
texts.en:
Rosa Elena has three children in farming. She works on the land and helps her family with everything that is needed. 

Through a lot of effort she has built her house but she has not been able to finish it, so she is asking for a loan of one million thirty-five thousand colones (1,35,000.00) in order to buy supplies and pay for labor. Rosa Elena wants to speed up the construction work as the rainy season is approaching and she needs to finish her home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Llapanchispac Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; Este banco se ubicado en  la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Agripina,la socia tiene 51 años es casada y tiene 03 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia ofrece desayunos,almuerzo y cenas todos los días ,a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de verduras, fotocopiadoras, crianza de animales menores, vidriería, elaboración de proyectos, docentes, maestro constructor.

El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank Llapanchispac. This bank is located in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Agripina. She is 51 years old, married, and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business. She has years experience in this business which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in each day to her business. She offers breakfast, lunch and dinner every day. She also works raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, and this is the way she supports her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as oil and rice among others. 

The other members work include selling vegetables, photocopiers, small animal husbandry, glassworks, project development, teachers and master builder.

The member left out of the accompanying photo asked permission to arrive after the meeting because of work commitments. 

The member thanks those who are a part of this dream by this means and she agrees to complete the payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as oil, rice and other items.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang was born in 1973. She has three children. They are learning at high school and secondary school. Her husband is a cattle seller. His income is about 8,000,000 VND. Hang is a worker. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 11,000,000 VND per month.
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy cattle for selling. She always wants to raise her children up well.

loans.use: to buy cattle for selling.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
El señor Joaquín es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  ganado. 
Don Joaquín el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  vacas.  Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos.
Don Joaquín  con esta inversión espera mejorar un poco su situación  económica y la de su  familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona y poder seguir  apoyando a su familia.
Don Joaquín sus sueño es que sus nietos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honestas  con principios y valores.





Choluteca, Honduras  –  Enero del   2013
texts.en:
Joaquín is a trustworthy, hardworking, and honest person. He lives with his wife and five children in southern Honduras. His  business is buying and selling cattle.

Joaquín needs a loan to buy cows. He is hoping that with a loan that the sales in his business will increase upon having more merchandise to offer his clients and to cover the necessities for them.

Joaquín hopes that this investment improves the financial standing for his family. For the next few years he hopes that his business continues growing and getting stronger in order to become the biggest and best known in the area and so be able to continue supporting his family.

Joaquín’s dream is to have his grandchildren finish their studies and become honest people of principles and values.

Choluteca, Honduras - January 2013

loans.use: to buy cows for his business

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa was born in 1965. She has two children who are carpenters. Her husband is a building worker. His income is about 4,000,000 VND. Hoa raises chickens and does carpentry to earn a living. She has done this job for 10 years. Her income is about 2,500,000 dong [VND]. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month.
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She aspires to enlarge her workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Efren

texts.es:
El señor Efrén es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive  con  esposa  y   sus  3 hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, su negocio es una pulpería.
Don Efrén el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de refrescos, carne, maíz, leche, frijoles, manteca, jabón, salsas, pastas, cubitos, especias, sal, pan, etc. Con  el crédito  espera tener más mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes para  poder cubrir los pedidos que estos le hacen a diario.
Don Efrén con los ingresos obtenidos espera que su condición de vida y la de su familia mejore un poco. En el futuro espera que su negocio sea una  pulpería más  grande.
Don Efrén  sueña con ver a sus hijos y nietos graduados y convertidos en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades  para la  sociedad



Choluteca, Honduras –  Enero del  2013
texts.en:
Efrén is a very responsible, honest, and hard-working person. He lives with his wife and three children in a town in southern Honduras. His business is a small grocery store. Efrén needs the loan to buy soft drinks, meat, corn, milk, beans, butter, soup, salsas, pasta, bullion cubes, spices, salt, bread, etc. With the loan, he hopes to have more merchandise to offer to his customers, in order to be able to fill the orders they bring him daily. With the income he makes, Efrén hopes that his and his family's quality of life will improve a bit. He hopes that his business will be a larger grocery store in the future. He dreams of seeing his children and grandchildren graduate and become respectable people with better opportunities for society.

Choluteca, Honduras –  January 2013

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meat, corn, milk, beans, butter, soup, salsas, pasta, bullion cubes, spices, salt, bread, etc. for his business

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Tan was born in 1985. She has four children. Her two older children are learning at primary school. Her two younger kids are under 4 years old. Her husband sells fruit in the market and earns about 3,500,000 VND per month. Tan also sells fruit in the market. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 15 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,500,000 VND per month. 

Tan has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy more fruit for selling. She always wants to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: G.s Bo.suyapa Group

texts.es:
La Señora Vilma es una señora muy luchadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su hijo. Su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace 15 años, el cual es visitado a diario por los vecinos de su comunidad.  
Doña Vilma necesita  el préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como ser maíz, cal y leña que son necesarios para la elaboración de su producto. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten al tener la materia prima para la elaboración de su producto y con esto ganar más ingresos.
Doña Vilma Sueña que en unos años su negocio sea más grande y reconocido de su comunidad y gracias a esto seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que termine sus estudios y que se convierta en personas de bien y con  mayores oportunidades en la vida.
Doña Vilma al igual que sus compañeras de grupo espera que su estilo de vida y el de su familia mejore un poco con la inversión realizada en sus negocios
Doña Dilcia tiene 32 años, su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace 5 años.
Don Julio tiene 39 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y mas desde hace 15 años.



Choluteca, Honduras – Enero 2013
texts.en:
Vilma is a very determined woman who lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her son. For 15 years she has had a business selling tortillas, which is patronized daily by the neighbors in the community.

Vilma needs the loan to buy more raw materials such as corn, lime, and firewood that are necessary in order to make her product. With the loan, she hopes that her sales will increase when she has the raw material to make her product, and with this she will earn more income.

Vilma dreams that in a few years her business will be bigger and more recognized in her community, and that thanks to this she will continue supporting her sons so that they will finish their studies and become well-off people with better opportunities in life.

Along with her fellow members, Vilma hopes her lifestyle and that of her family will improve a little with the investment made in their businesses.

Dilcia is 32, and for 5 years she has had a business selling tortillas.

Julio is 39, and for 15 years he has had a business selling new clothing and more.

Choluteca, Honduras - January 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and firewood for her business

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam was born in 1963. She has two children. Her youngest child is attending university. Her older child is a carpenter.  Her husband is a worker and earns about 2,500,000 VND per month. Nam does carpentry to earn a living. Her income is about 3,500,000 VND. She has done this job for 7 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She hope is to raise her children up well.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Chonimacorral Group

texts.es:
La señora Paulina Susana esta casada, tiene 29 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación secundaria, ella esta graduada de enfermera, tiene un hijo pequeño, se dedica actualmente a la elaboración de delantales, trabajo que inicio siendo empleada en otro negocio, hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas típicas, quiere aumentar su volumen de producción de delantales, esperando en el futuro contar con una maquila con varios productos. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la atención a tienda en general, crianza de animales confección de tejidos, venta de sandalias, y taller de bicicleta.
texts.en: Paulina Susana is 29 years old and married. She finished secondary school and she is trained as a nurse. She has a young child. Currently she works making aprons, work that she started while employed at another business. She has 10 years of experience. She has the support of her husband, who works in construction. Paulina organizes a group and applies for a loan that she will use to buy typical fabrics. She wants to increase her production volume of aprons, hoping to have a workshop with assorted products in the future. The other group members work running a store, raising animals, textile production, sandal sales, and running a bicycle shop.

loans.use: to buy typical fabrics

loans.name: G.s Esfuerzo Y Voluntad Group

texts.es:
El señor Andrés tiene 58 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo que depende de él,  vive con su esposa, Su actividad es el comercio, tiene una pulpería y cuenta con más de 6 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad generadora de ingresos.
Don Andrés tiene muy buena clientela porque su negocio es el único en su sector, siendo sus principales clientes los habitantes de su colonia, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra queso, leña, maíz, azúcar, manteca, embutidos, carnes, frijoles, leche, huevos y sal para surtir su negocio y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Don Andrés su sueños es tener una sala de venta mejor acondicionada y darle calidad de vida su familia.
Don Andrés junto con los integrantes de su grupo con el préstamo solicitado esperan les contribuya a tener una existencia de productos  y mejorar su surtido para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, a su vez esperan mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Doña Norma  se dedica  al engorde de pollos y gallinas ponedoras.
Doña Anita cuenta con una pulpería.




Danli, Honduras - Enero 2013
texts.en:
Andrés is 58 years old and has one child who is still dependent on him.  Andrés lives with his wife and he makes a living from his business.  He has had a grocery store for six years now and this is how he earns his income.

Andrés has very good customers because his business is the only one of its type in the area.  His main customers are the locals living here.  He is applying for a loan to buy cheese, firewood, corn, sugar, butter, cold meat, meats, beans, milk, eggs and salt to stock up his store and so satisfy customers' demands.

Andrés' dream is to have a room better set up for his business and to give his family a better quality of life.

Together with the other members of his group, Andrés hopes that the loan will contribute to better and improved stock in order to satisfy the demands of his customers. At the same time he hopes to increase his income so as to cover household costs and other financial obligations.

Norma makes a living fattening up chickens and laying hens.

Anita has a grocery store.

In Danli, Honduras, January 2013

loans.use: to buy cheese, firewood, corn, sugar, butter, cold meat, meats, beans, milk, eggs and salt, for the business.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien was born in 1963. She has four children who are adults. Her husband is a wine cook and earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. Hien raises pigs to earn a living. Her income is about 5,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 10 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Xetrubala Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es madre soltera, tiene  35 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de animales, trabajo que inicio criando pollos de engorde y ponedoras, actualmente lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de cerdos y una vaca, quiere que su granja sea mas grande y con varios animales, espera extender su granja y mejorar sus ventas. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la crianza de animales. Una de las señoras de la fotos no califico para el préstamo.
texts.en: Carmen is 35 years old and was not fortunate enough to go to school. She raises her five children on her own. One of them is a student. She raises animals for a living, having started out with chickens and hens ten years ago. Her husband is a mason and helps her financially. Carmen put together a group to ask for a loan that she will use to buy pigs and a cow. She wants her barn to have more animals and grow in order to increase her sales. The other members of the group also raise animals. One of the women in the photo was originally in the group but she did not qualify for the loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs and a cow/

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Santa Rosa De Lima” es un grupo dinámico la cual está conformada por 08 socios, dicho grupo pasan  su 5to ciclo. Siendo Jaqueline una de las socias, ella lleva el cargo de tesorera, la cual fue elegida por sus compañeros. Jaqueline tiene 39 años, casada con 02 hijos aún dependientes.  Viendo que los ingresos de su esposo como albañil no alcanzaban para cubrir con los gastos del hogar, decide iniciar su propio negocio, donde actualmente cuenta con una bodega, brindando productos de primera necesidad.  Aparte se dedica a la venta siembra de alfalfa de donde obtiene un ingreso extra. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de productos como abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas.  Se siente feliz y agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Jaqueline se encuentra ubicada en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado derecho, viste chompa roja y pantalón celeste.
texts.en: "Santa Rosa de Lima" communal bank is a group full of energy that comprises eight members. They are in their fifth cycle of loans with the field partner. Jaqueline, one of the members, was elected treasurer by the others. She is 39, married, and has two children, who are still in her care. Seeing that her spouse's income, earned as a mason, was not enough to cover household expenses, she decided to start her own business, a grocery shop, where she sells basic products. She also sells alfalfa seeds as a way to earn a little more money. She will use the loan in order to buy supplies for her shop, such as groceries, drinks, and sweets. She is happy for the opportunity and thanks the people who made this loan possible. On the photo, Jaqueline is the second person from the right in the back row, wearing light blue trousers and a red shirt.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks, and sweets.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai was born in 1985. She has two children who are learning at primary school and kindergarten. Her husband is a driver. Hai sells vegetables and fruit to earn a living. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 6,496,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy vegetables and fruit for selling.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit for selling.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1981. She has four children. They are learning at secondary school, primary school and kindergarten. Her husband is a driver and earns about 6,000,000 VND per month. Thuy sells nuts, seeds, and fruit to earn a living. She earns 4,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 
	
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy vegetables and fruit to sell. She wants to raise her children well so that they can get good paying jobs in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan was born in 1985. She has two sons who are little. The family’s total earnings are about 8,500,000 VND per month. Her husband is a truck driver. His income is about 6,000,000 dong [VND]. Loan sells groceries to earn a living and she gets 2,500,000 VND every month from that job.

Loan has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy rice, noodles and canned food for her grocery store. She always wants to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles and canned food for her grocery store.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna de 45 años de edad, es madre soltera , tiene dos  hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa propia, vive en la comunidad  de San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace 16 años  al negocio de venta comida y golosinas.
Doña Reyna sus clientes son empleados de un taller de motos cerca de su negocio, también las personas que viajan en sus carros y medios de transporte de carga.
Doña Reyna  su negocio está ubicado a la orilla de la carretera panamericana, es un buena cliente luchadora que desea sacar adelante a su familia.
Doña Reyna  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de carnes, pataste, cebolla, chiles, zanahorias, remolachas,platanos, arroz y frescos. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera que  su condición de vida mejore  un poco.
Doña Reyna está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma tiene cuatro ciclos de trabajar y ha demostrado  ser una buena clienta. 
Doña Reyna su sueño es que sus hijos se le gradúen de la universidad.


 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013
texts.en:
Reyna, 45 years old, is a single mother. She has two children who are still dependent on her. She lives in a house of her own in the town of San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras. She has been selling food and sweets for sixteen years. Her customers are usually the employees of a motorcycle repair shop just down the street, as well as passing travellers and lorry drivers. Her shop is located right next to the Panamerican motorway. Reyna is a very good borrower, who fights for the sake of her family. She asks for this loan in order to buy the ingredients needed to prepare the food she sells: meat, chayote, onions, chili peppers, carrots, beetroot, plantain, rice, and other fresh ingredients. With this loan, she hopes to improve her quality of life. She is very happy with her partnership with the lending institution, and is in her fourth cycle of loans with it. She always repaid on time. Her dream is to see her children become university graduates.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2013

loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Anh was born in 1991. She has only one little kid. The family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. Her husband is a worker and his income is about 3,500,000 dong [VND]. Loan is a carpenter and raises pigs to earn a living. Her income is about 3,500,000 VND per month.

Anh has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,840,000 VND to buy food for pigs. She also always wants to raise her children well.

Other members who are part of Anh's group include the following:
 
	 Ha was born in 1968. She has four children. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
 
	 Tung was born in 1983. He has three children. He wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise pigs for selling.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1967. She has five children: two of them have got married, one is now employed as a worker and two others are still learning at high school and secondary school. Her husband and she are fisherman and raise pigs to earn a living. Lan earns 3,500,000 VND per month. The family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month.
 
Lan has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy food for her pigs. She also always wants to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Tin

texts.en:
Tin was born in 1985. She has two children who are under 5 years old. Her husband is a carpenter and earns 5,000,000 VND per month. Tin is an artistic carpenter and also raises chickens to earn more money. She gets 3,000,000 VND a month from it. She has done this job for five years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

	She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 6,496,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy food for raising chickens. Her dream is to be able to let her children have good careers and to save more money to fix up her house.

loans.use: to buy food for raising chickens.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh was born in 1987. She has two children who are five and six years old. Her husband is a driver and earns 5,000,000 VND per month. Thanh cooks traditional food in the market to earn a living. She has done this for 2 years. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 6,496,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy noodles and beef to cook her food in the market. She has always wants to raise her children well and to buy a new truck for her husband to do his job.

loans.use: to buy noodles and beef to cook her food in the market.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en: Hiep was born in 1968. She has seven children. The two older children are married and the others are in university, the 12th grade, the 9th grade, the 5th grade and the 3rd grade. Her husband raises chickens and earns about 6,000,000 VND per month. Hiep also raises chickens, grows vegetables and sells food in the market to earn a living. Her income is also about 6,000,000 VND per month, making her family’s total earnings about 12,000,000 VND per month. Hiep has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy chicken feed. She always wants to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria es una mujer microempresaria emprendedora de 57 años de edad, madre soltera con cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, su negocio consiste en la venta  cosméticos de la Avon, comercializa zapatos, ropa variada, etc. actividad que viene realizando desde hace 28 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la  compra de útiles escolares como cuadernos universitarios, uniformes como faldas, camisas, pantalones, lapiceros, crayones, borradores, estuches geométricos, mochilas etc.
texts.en: Gloria, aged 57, is a small business owner full of enterprising spirit. A single mother, she has five children, all of whom are now adults. She sells various products, mainly Avon cosmetics, shoes, clothes, etc. She has had this business for 28 years. She will use the loan to buy school supplies and uniforms to sell: notebooks, skirts, shirts, trousers, pens, paper, pencil cases, backpacks, and other items.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and uniforms to sell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de  cosméticos  desde hace  más de 15 años.
Doña Teresa el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de lociones, cremas,  desinfectantes, talcos, perfumes,  etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más de  variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes. 
Doña Teresa espera cubrir un poco las necesidades  que tiene y con esto mejorar  su situación  económica y la de su familia. 
Doña  Teresa en unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de los negocios  más grande de la zona, así también  que sus hijos  se convierta en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Febrero del   2013
texts.en:
Teresa is a responsible, honest, and hard-working person. She lives with her children in the municipality of Choluteca, in the southern part of Honduras. She has been selling cosmetics for over fifteen years. She will use the loan to buy merchandise to sell, such as: lotions, creams, disinfectant, talcum powder, perfume, and others. She hopes to boost her sales with this loan, because it will enable her to have a wider variety of products on offer. She hopes to meet some expenses with her sales and thus to improve her and her family's economic conditions. She hopes to keep her business growing and to be one of the top sellers in the area in a few years. She wishes dearly for her children to grow into honest adults and to have better opportunities in life than those afforded to her.
Choluteca, Honduras - February 2013

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Luz Adilia

texts.es: Luz Adilia es una microempresaria de éxito  su negocio es un Bar cafetín donde vende comidas variadas, gaseosas, cocteles variados, desde hace 13 años, es casada, tiene un hijo menor de 8 años y su esposo y ella atienden el negocio, ella ha realizado varios créditos lo que ha venido invirtiendo en mejoras del local para una mejor presentación y atracción de los clientes, sus logros y metas es que ha mejorado su vivienda, su negocio ha aumentado en cuanto a que hace una variedad de comidas, cocteles, bocas y mantiene un stop de inventario de productos. El crédito lo quiere invertir en renovar los permisos que exigen las autoridades del país como renovar permiso de la policía por venta de licor, permiso de sanidad por vender alimento, institución de turismo, cuerpo de bombero para la seguridad de  la clientela y además invertir en la compra de gaseosas, materia prima para alimentos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, plátanos, verduras, perecederos, mariscos etc.
texts.en: Luz Adilia's small business is quite successful. She has a small bar and eatery where she has been serving various dishes, drinks, and cocktails for thirteen years. She is married and has a son who is eight years old. Her husbands helps her with the bar. This is far from being her first loan; she invested the previous ones into renovating the premises in order to make the shop look nicer and attract more customers. She has been successful in improving her home, her business, and the variety of the meals and cocktails she serves, as well as increasing her stock of ingredients. She will use this loan to renew the various licences imposed by the law in her country, such as the one to sell liquor, the health inspection certificate for catering businesses, the certificate for tourism-oriented businesses, and the fire safety licence that guarantees the safety of her customers. She will also use the funds to buy the supplies she needs: soft drinks, rice, broad beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, plaintains, vegetables, dairy products, shellfish, etc.

loans.use: to renew various licences for her business and to buy supplies.

loans.name: Aida  Luz

texts.es: Microempresaria de éxito es doña Aida que se dedica a vender verduras, frutas frescas, enchiladas, pupusas salvadoreñas, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 10 años, es una mujer con unión libre tiene dos hijos mayores, tiene 59 años de edad, sus nietos le ayudan en su negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de verduras como chayote, ayote, tomate, chiltoma, cebolla dulce, limón agrio, plátanos, frutas frescas como naranjas, piñas, banano, papaya, etc.
texts.en: Aida's business is quite successful. She sells vegetables, fresh fruit, enchiladas, and pupusas (a traditional dish made of a sweetcorn tortilla filled with cheese, meat, and beans), and has been doing so for the past ten years. She lives with her partner, with whom she has two adult children. She is 59 and her grandchildren help her with her business. She will use the loan to buy vegetables, such as chayote, squash, tomatoes, sweet peppers, sweet onions, lime, and plaintain, as well as fresh fruit such as oranges, pineapples, bananas, papayas, and others.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
La señora  Rosibel  es una persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora vive con  su esposo y sus 3  hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta  de comida desde hace más de 15 años.
Doña Rosibel el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de condimentos, carne pollo, res, arroz, sal, papas, pastaste, yuca, salsas, plátanos, cebollas, chiles que son las materia prima para elaborar sus comidas.
Doña Rosibel con el crédito  espera  que sus ventas aumenten debido a que contara con más capital fresco y productos  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan  a diario.
Doña Rosibel así mismo desea que mejore su situación económica en el hogar y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años  espera que su comedor  este posicionado como uno de los más grandes y  conocido de la zona  y poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos a que se convierta en persona de bien  y con mejores oportunidades.





Choluteca, Honduras –  Febrero  del 2013
texts.en:
Rosibel is an honest, hard-working, and responsible person.  She lives with her husband and their three children in a community in southern Honduras.  She has had her business of selling food for over 15 years.

Rosibel needs the loan to buy condiments, meat, chicken, beef, rice, salt, potatoes, dough, yucca, salsas, bananas, onions, and chilies.  These are the ingredients she needs to make her food.  Roseibel hopes that her sales will increase with the loan.  This will be because she will have more fresh capital and products to offer the customers who visit her daily.

Rosibel wishes to improve the financial situation in her home, and she hopes to see that manifested with this investment.  In a few years she hopes that her eatery is positioned as one of the biggest and well-known in the area.  She hopes to be able to continue supporting her children and that they become good people with better opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras – February, 2013

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Aurora Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Francisca Antonia esta soltera, tiene  39 años de edad, cursó los 5 años de educación primaria, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa típica para mujeres, cortes, blusas, guipiles, fajas, etc. Inicio este trabajo siendo empleada en otro negocio y hasta ahora lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería para la venta: cortes, fajas, guipiles, y entre otros productos necesarios, ella espera en el futuro tener amplio capital y tener un negocio con variedad para vender. Las demás integrantes del grupos se dedican a la crianza de animales, elaboración de bordados y a la confección de prendas.
texts.en:
Francisca Antonia, 39, is single, she completed the five years of primary schooling and makes her living selling traditional clothes for women: traditional skirts, blouses, traditional tunics, woven belts and so on. She started this work as she is employed in another business and to date has six years of experience.

She leads a group to seek a loan which she will use to buy merchandise for the sale of traditional skirts, blouses, woven belts and traditional tunics among the other products needed. She hopes that in the future she will have enough capital and have a business with a variety of goods to sell. The other members of the group make their living rearing animals, embroidering and making clothes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Carmenza Idalia

texts.es:
Carmenza de 59 años de edad, es una mujer entregada a su hogar. Dedicó la  mayor parte de su vida a velar por el bienestar y la educación de sus cuatro hijos. Hoy ya son adultos, por lo cual Carmenza decidió montar su propio negocio con el propósito de mantenerse ocupada y generar ingresos para colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la sala de su casa pero desea realizar adecuaciones en el patio de su vivienda para ofrecer un mejor servicio y obtener mayores ganancias. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de silletería y en la fabricación de un piso de cemento ya que su patio es de tierra.

Asegura que mientras hay vida hay esperanza y que a pesar de su edad su mayor sueño en convertirse en una mujer de negocios.
texts.en:
Carmenza, 59, is a woman dedicated to her home. She has spent the vast majority of her life looking after the well-being and education of her four children. Her children are now adults, and therefore Carmenza decided to set up her own business to keep her occupied and to generate an income to help her husband with the household costs. Her business is located in the living room of her home but she wants to make changes in the courtyard of her home to offer a better service and gain larger profits. For this reason, Carmenza is seeking a loan which she will invest in the purchase of seats and laying a cement floor as her courtyard is of soil.

Carmenza asserts that as long as there is life, there is hope, and that despite her age, her ultimate dream is to become a business woman.

loans.use: to buy candy, sweet items, cookies, and other snacks

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es: Saludos cordiales: Este es el nuevo grupo “San Martin” conformado por 07 socios entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar. Jeremías uno de los integrantes, tiene 57 años de edad casada con hijos independientes. El se dedica a la venta de bebidas como gaseosas, agua mineral y gaseosas. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo y la ayuda de su esposa a podido sacar adelante a su familia. Su mayor deseo es de poner otro puesto  de venta de bebidas pues así asegura, tendrá mayores ganancias. El dinero obtenido lo destinará para la compra de gaseosas, cervezas y agua minera.   El nuevo grupo “San Martín” agradecen a los prestamistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Jeremías es el primero del lado derecho viste camisa crema y pantalón plomo.
texts.en:
Greetings: This is the new group “San Martin” formed by seven enthusiastic members getting established. 

Jeremías is one of the members. He is 57 years old, married with adult children. He works selling beverages such as soft drinks and mineral water. With the fruit of his labor and the help from his wife he could bring up the family. His greatest desire to to open another beverage stand and thus be sure of having higher earnings. The money he borrows will be used to buy soft drinks, beer and mineral water. 

The new group “San Martin” is grateful to the Kiva loaners for their support. Jeremías is the first on the right side wearing a cream colored shirt and gray slacks.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, water, and beer for his beverage stand.

loans.name: Erika Vanessa

texts.es:
Érika es una joven de 23 años de edad, reside en una vereda del municipio de Itagüí y desde hace 6 meses cuenta con negocio propio gracias a la colaboración de su hermano.
Su actividad se enfoca principalmente en la prestación de servicios de papelería y miscelánea. Su mayor sueño es poder expandir su negocio e incorporar la venta de productos de la canasta familiar debido a la demanda de sus clientes. 
Agradece profundamente a Dios por la oportunidad y el regalo dado, ya que gracias a su trabajo sus dos hijos de seis y ocho años de edad, tendrán la oportunidad de ingresar a la escuela a realizar su primaria.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una fotocopiadora y mercancía, con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Érika is a 23-year-old woman, she lives in village in the Itagüí municipality and for the last six months she has been running her own business thanks to her brother's help. Her activity mainly focuses on selling stationery and other miscellaneous goods. Her ultimate dream is to expand her business and incorporate the sale of basic grocery goods given the demand from her customers. 

She is deeply grateful to God for the opportunity and the present that she has been given, as it is thanks to her work that her two children, aged six and eight years old, that they will have the opportunity of attending school and complete primary schooling.

Today Érika is seeking a loan to buy a photocopier and goods, with the aim of increasing her sales and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies, a display case and shelving to increase the variety of products she offers her customers.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis de 41 años, es padre de dos hijos, por los cuales vela a fin de ofrecerles una vida digna y mejores oportunidades de educación. Su vida se ha visto plagada por desaciertos y malas decisiones. Pero a pesar de las situaciones vividas le sobran ganas de luchar en búsqueda de un mejor futuro para su familia. Cansado de buscar empleo y ver como las puertas de las oportunidades se le cerraban frente a sus ojos, decidió auto-emplearse y montar su propio negocio en su vivienda. Creó una pequeña tienda en la que comercializa productos de la canasta familiar, y los fines de semana abre al público un carro de comidas rápidas a fin de generar mayores ingresos y brindarle mayor  bienestar a su familia.
 Hoy se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito para la compra de surtido para sus dos negocios con el propósito de incrementar su nivel de ventas y aumentar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis, 41, is father to two children for whom he strives to offer them a dignified life and better educational opportunities. His life has been plagued by mistakes and poor decisions. However, despite the situations he has lived through, he is still keen to fight for a better future for his family. Tired of searching for work and seeing the doors of opportunity closing before his eyes, Alirio decided to employ himself and set up his own business in his home. He established a small store in which he sells basic grocery goods, and over the weekends he opens a fast-food stall to the public in order to generate larger sales and provide his family with a better level of well-being. Alirio is now seeking a loan to buy stock for both of his two businesses with the aim of increasing his sales and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grocery goods.

loans.name: Norma Del Socorro

texts.es: Norma microempresaria de éxito se dedica a venta de tortilla, y comida en su domicilio, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 20 años, inicia su negocio haciendo tortillas, poco a poco fue haciendo comida hasta hoy, tiene 54 años de edad, tiene tres hijos mayores quienes le ayudan en la administración en el negocio, el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña, cal, granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, verduras, perecederos etc.
texts.en: Norma's business is quite successful. She has been selling tortillas and other meals at her home for twenty years. She started with only tortillas but is now selling many other types of meals. She is 54 years old and has three adult children, who help her manage her business. She will use the loan to buy the ingredients and supplies needed to prepare the food she sells, such as sweetcorn, firewood, lime, rice and other basic grains, sugar, oil, veal, chicken, vegetables, fresh fruit, etc.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients and supplies needed to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pigs and cows.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario de 60 años de edad, es un campesino del municipio de Sonsón, dedicado a la agricultura desde su juventud. Actualmente cultiva fríjol, tomate de árbol y papa criolla. Con esta actividad ha logrado garantizarles a sus tres hijos acceso a la educación y una mejor calidad de vida.  
Desde hace 5 años decidió combinar la agricultura con la comercialización de productos, por lo cual en su municipio alquiló una bodega con el fin de comercializarlos. Con el propósito de aumentar sus ventas, se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras con lo que prestará el servicio de legumbrería.
Mario es un hombre lleno de sueños, por los que luchará hasta convertirlos en realidad, el más importante es comprar el lote en donde tiene sus siembres ya que alquiler es costoso lo que ocasiona reducción en sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mario is 60 years old. He is a farmer from the area of Sonsón. He has been working in agriculture since childhood. Currently he grows beans, tamarillos, and yellow potatoes. Through this activity he guaranteed his children access to education and a better quality of life.

Five years ago he decided to combine farming and selling products, so he rented a warehouse in his community to market them. With the purpose of expanding his sales, he is requesting a loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables using the loan for the vegetable service.

Mario is a man full of dreams, struggling for them until they become a reality. The most important thing is to buy the parcel of land he cultivates as the rent is expensive and reduces his profit.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven de 20 años y a su corta edad le ha tocado asumir grandes responsabilidades debido al fallecimiento de su padre. Su familia ha laborado por mucho tiempo en la fabricación de calzado en un pequeño taller ubicado en su casa, legado que hoy le ha tocado asumir por ser el hombre mayor. Labora en horas de la tarde en compañía de su medre debido a que en la mañana estudia.
Su mayor sueño es poder crear una marca propia para aumentar sus ingresos y garantizarle a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida. En pro de su proyecto de negocio, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de cuero e insumos para la fabricación de calzado escolar, con el fin de aprovechar la gran demanda del producto en la temporada estudiantil.
Su madre y sus hermanos son su gran prioridad. Su mayor reto es poderles ofrecer una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 20 year old youth and at his young age he has had to assume great responsibilities due to the death of his father. His family has worked for a long time making shoes in a little workshop located in his home, a legacy that today he has taken over since he is the eldest male. He works during the afternoon with his mother because he goes to school in the morning.

His greatest dream is to be able to create his own brand to increase earnings and to guarantee his family better opportunities in life. For the sake of his business project, he is asking for a loan to buy leather and supplies in order to make school shoes, in order to take advantage of the product demand in the student season.

His mother and his siblings are his greatest priority. His biggest challenge is to be able to offer greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy leather and supplies for making school shoes.

loans.name: Roman Alberto

texts.es:
Roman es un hombre de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, Roman es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con el apoyo de su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Roman pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Mariscos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Roman trabaja en el área de obras en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Roman se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de hospitalización y medicinas para su esposa, ya que sufre una penosa enfermedad y requiere con urgencia ser operada, de esta manera Roman espera poder aliviar en algo las dolencias y mejorar la salud de esposa, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder darles una buena educación a sus hijas y desea verlas convertidas en buenas profesionales.
texts.en:
Roman is a 36-year-old man who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago. He lives with his wife and two small children, whom he loves, and they are his main reason for living.

Roman is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who, along with his wife, puts all of his effort toward supporting his family. Thanks to the effort and support of his parents, Roman was able to study a professional degree in Civil Engineering. In his spare time, he likes to watch television and he occasionally makes a delicious dish of rice with seafood to share with his family. 

On his own initiative, with a lot of determination and dedication, Roman works in the public works sector of a municipal company in his city. He works every day beginning in the early morning, and he can work for about 8 hours. He feels comfortable doing his job and believes that it is going well because of his strong performance and the kind way in which he treats others.

Roman is very appreciative of Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help provided, he will be able to pay for hospitalization costs and medicine for his wife, who is suffering from a painful illness and needs surgery urgently. With the loan, Roman hopes to improve her health and alleviate her suffering somewhat. He will continue working and pushing himself to achieve his great dream of providing his daughters with a good education. He wants to see them grow up to be good professionals.

loans.use: to cover the health expenses of his wife.

loans.name: Agua De La Vida De Viacha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUA DE LA VIDA DE VIACHA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: lechería y ganadería, macramé, costura de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido a macramé; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de los mercados de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Agua de la Vida de Viacha” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Adela. It is made up of six members and is headed by a board where Sonia is the president. The business that the members of the communal bank are in are varied and among them are: dairy and livestock, macramé, and sewing skirts.

The loan they are taking will benefit small microentrepreneurs where Sonia is a member. She says that it is her first time as a member of Pro Mujer, joining through invitation from a supporter of the institution that came to her home. Currently she has a macramé weaving business. This business she learned from her aunt some years ago.

The loan that she is now taking is to increase her capital (to buy wool) that she will buy in the El Alto markets at wholesale and later her creations are sold by order. This way of working permits her to generate income in order to maintain as much as possible her household, as she is single and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training covering health and savings.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: Angélica es una microempresaria que se dedica a vender leñas ambulantes, y en su domicilio, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 5 años. Es madre soltera con dos hijos menores, anteriormente era ama de casa y actualmente cuenta con su negocio para seguir adelante con su familia. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de leña en acopio por la temporada del invierno.
texts.en:
Angélica, a small businesswoman, sells firewood in an itinerant manner and at her house.  She has been doing this for five years.

She is a single mother with two minor children.  Previously she was a housewife, and she now has her business in order to get ahead with her family.

She will use the loan to buy firewood for the winter season.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.es:
La señora Venancia  de 50  años de edad,  no tiene   hijos   que dependan  de ella, vive con su esposo en su casa propia,  ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 03  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería y refrescos.
Doña Venancia sus clientes son los estudiantes y personas que a diario le visitan, familiares y amigos, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de sacar adelante a su familia.
Doña Venancia está solicitando el préstamo para compra  de abarrotería como ser frescos, churros, galletas, huevos, leche, pan, manteca, harina, frijoles, azúcar, café, arroz, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su negocio porque tendrá más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Doña Venancia su sueño es mejorar su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013.
texts.en:
Venancia, age 50, does not have dependent children.  She lives with her husband in her own house.  The house is located in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras.  She has been selling groceries and soft drinks for three years.

Venancia’s customers are students, people who visit her business daily, relatives, and friends.  She is a hard-working woman with the desire to get her family ahead.

Venancia is requesting the loan to buy groceries like soft drinks, churros, cookies, eggs, milk, bread, shortening, flour, beans, sugar, coffee, and rice, etc.  With the support of the loan she intends to improve her income and her business.  This is because she will have more products to offer her customers.  

Venancia’s dream is to improve her business.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - February, 2013.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: El Baile Del 10 Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ella es Angélica quien se dedica a vender productos de trastes de  cocina plásticos, melamina, vidrio etc., tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, comercializa sus productos en los departamentos del país junto con su esposo que le ayuda a comercializar sus productos, el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de artículos de cocinas como panas, platos de vidrio, platos de melanina, hoyas de aluminio, baldes plásticos, vasos de vidrios, vasos de plásticos etc., Lea tiene una farmacia y Víctor tiene una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is comprised of three members.  One of the entrepreneurs, Angélica, sells plastic kitchen utensils made of melamine, glass, and other materials.
